Q.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
Q.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

metadata.background_info:
[Rishi Sunak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rishi_Sunak?useskin=vector), born 12 May 1980, is a British politician who has served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party since 2022. Sunak has been Member of Parliament for [Richmond (Yorks)](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Richmond_(Yorks)_(UK_Parliament_constituency)&useskin=vector) since 2015.

In the most recent general election in 2019, [Sunak won his seat](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Richmond_(Yorks)_(UK_Parliament_constituency)&useskin=vector#Elections_in_the_2010s) with 63.6% of the vote; the nearest competitor was the Labour Party candidate on 16.4% of the vote. 

Since 2019 the Conservative Party, in power since 2010, has seen a significant decline in its support according to [opinion polling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2024_United_Kingdom_general_election?useskin=vector#Graphical_summary); and as of late May 2024, it trails the opposition Labour Party by around 20 points. 

[Sunak's personal approval rating](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leadership_approval_opinion_polling_for_the_2024_United_Kingdom_general_election?useskin=vector) has been in negative territory for nearly his entire tenure as Prime Minister, and is [among the worst for any British Conservative or Labour leader](https://www.ipsos.com/en-uk/rishi-sunaks-satisfaction-falls-equal-worst-ever-ipsos-rating-conservative-or-labour-leader) in Ipsos data going back to 1978.

In May 2024 [Sunak called a snap general election](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-69050450), to be held on July 4.

Sunak is expected to contest the constituency of [Richmond and Northallerton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richmond_and_Northallerton_(UK_Parliament_constituency)?useskin=vector) in the July 4 election, which was created following the [2023 Periodic Review of Westminster constituencies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2023_Periodic_Review_of_Westminster_constituencies?useskin=vector).

reasons: Both questions pertain to significant political figures and their electoral prospects, which may have interconnected implications for their respective parties and political landscapes.

The outcomes of these events could influence public opinion and party strategies leading up to the elections, making it relevant for political analysts and forecasters to consider their combined probabilities.
If Biden were to drop out, it might change the dynamics of the US presidential race, which could indirectly affect international perceptions and strategies regarding UK elections.
relevance.conclusion: It makes sense to consider the logical combination of these questions due to the interrelated nature of political events and their potential impact on each other.

P.title: Will Masoud Pezeshkian win the 2024 Iranian Presidential election?
P.body:
This question will resolve **Yes** if Masoud Pezeshkian is announced as the winner of the 2024 Iranian presidential election, as reported by [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) or the [IRNA](https://en.irna.ir/) agency. It will resolve **No** if Jalili wins.

If some outcome happens that is not one of the candidates being announced as the winner, the question will be **Annulled**.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on Masoud Pezeshkian winning the 2024 Iranian Presidential election, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
Q_given_P.body:
This question combines two separate forecasting questions:

1. Suppose Masoud Pezeshkian is announced as the winner of the 2024 Iranian presidential election, as reported by credible sources or the IRNA agency. This resolves the first condition.

2. Given the above, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? This will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:
   - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Assessed Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

   The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
   - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
   - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

If the condition in part 1 is not met, the question is annulled.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Masoud Pezeshkian wins the 2024 Iranian Presidential election, and (b) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
P_and_Q.body:
This question will resolve **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Masoud Pezeshkian is announced as the winner of the 2024 Iranian presidential election, as reported by [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) or the [IRNA](https://en.irna.ir/) agency. It will resolve **No** if Jalili wins. If some outcome happens that is not one of the candidates being announced as the winner, this part of the question will be **Annulled**.

2. When accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories indicating Russian control:
   - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Assessed Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if either condition is not met. For the second condition, the location must not be assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
   - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
   - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

P.title: Will Masoud Pezeshkian win the 2024 Iranian Presidential election?
P.body:
This question will resolve **Yes** if Masoud Pezeshkian is announced as the winner of the 2024 Iranian presidential election, as reported by [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) or the [IRNA](https://en.irna.ir/) agency. It will resolve **No** if Jalili wins.

If some outcome happens that is not one of the candidates being announced as the winner, the question will be **Annulled**.

metadata.background_info:
Following the death of President Ebrahim Raisi in a helicopter crash on May 19th, Iran is holding new elections. After clerics vetoed several of the candidates, the ones allowed to run faced off on June 28th.

The very low turnout first round saw relative moderate Masoud Pezeshkian and hardliner Saeed Jalili advance to the runoff with 44% and 40% of the votes, respectively.

metadata.background_info: [Reporting suggests](https://www.politico.eu/article/russian-victory-over-ukranian-key-city-chasiv-yar-jeopardize-entire-donetsk-region/) that the Ukrainian military sees the city of Chasiv Yar as strategically significant, and that the capture of the city could jeopardize the remaining key cities in the [Donetsk oblast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donetsk_Oblast). reasons: The outcome of the Iranian presidential election could influence geopolitical dynamics in the region, including Russia's military strategies and territorial control in Ukraine.
If Masoud Pezeshkian wins, it could lead to changes in Iran's foreign policy, potentially affecting Russia's actions in Ukraine.
Both events are part of a broader geopolitical landscape that includes Iran's relationship with Russia and their respective roles in regional conflicts.
relevance.conclusion: It is worth considering the logical combination of these questions due to potential interdependencies in geopolitical outcomes.

P.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on the Olympic record for men's pole vault being broken, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: At the 2024 Paris Olympics, at least one men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, breaking the Olympic record according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. Then, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, it resolves as **Yes** if the same NOC has won at least two of these events. The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) the Olympic record for the men's pole vault is broken, and (b) the same nation wins more than one women's team sport?
P_and_Q.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources.

(b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in at least two of these eight women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

The question resolves as **No** if either condition is not met.

P.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
Brazilian pole vaulter Thiago Braz set the Olympic record for the men's pole vault at 6.03m at the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympics. Since then, the world record [has risen to 6.24m](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Men%27s_pole_vault_world_record_progression), set by Swedish athlete Armand Duplantis earlier in 2024. In 2020, his only chance so far to break the Olympic record, the Swede did succeed at his 6.19m WR attempt, though he had already won gold with 6.02m.

With Braz suspended from the current Games on account of doping, will his record be broken by the dominant world record holder, or maybe by another competitor?

The men's pole vault [is scheduled](https://olympics.com/en/paris-2024/schedule/athletics/men-s-pole-vault?day=3-august) to begin August 3, 2024.

Q.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
Q.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

metadata.background_info:
Although most events in the Summer Olympics are contested by individual athletes, or small teams of 2-4, a few have one single larger team representing their entire country. [These are](https://olympics.com/en/paris-2024/information/team-sports-how-can-your-team-qualify-for-the-paris-2024-olympics):

* Association football
* Basketball 5×5
* Basketball 3×3
* Field hockey
* Handball
* Rugby sevens
* Volleyball
* Water polo

(Beach volleyball is listed on the source but excluded from the question because two teams from each nation can qualify, unlike the other sports.)

Will the women's teams of the same nation win at least two of these sports? The

reasons: Both questions pertain to the same event, the 2024 Paris Olympics, making them contextually relevant.
The performance of athletes in individual events like pole vaulting may influence national pride and investment in team sports, potentially affecting the outcomes of women's team events.

There may be a correlation between the success of individual athletes and the overall success of a nation's teams, as successful athletes can inspire or boost the morale of teams from the same nation.
relevance.conclusion: It makes sense to consider the logical combination of these questions due to their potential interrelatedness within the context of the Olympics.

P.title: Will these AI labs launch a mechanism to enable users to understand if content is generated by their AIs before July 1, 2024? (Meta)
P.body: For each AI lab, this question resolves as **YES** if the lab publicly releases a tool to check if some text, audio, or visual content is generated by their AI models before July 1, 2024.

Q_given_P.title: If Meta launches a mechanism to verify AI-generated content by July 1, 2024, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6?
Q_given_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Meta publicly releases a tool to check if some text, audio, or visual content is generated by their AI models before July 1, 2024. Then, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6? This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Meta launches a mechanism to identify AI-generated content before July 1, 2024, and (b) an armed forces conflict death occurs between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024?
P_and_Q.body: (a) Meta launches a mechanism: This question resolves as **YES** if Meta publicly releases a tool to check if some text, audio, or visual content is generated by their AI models before July 1, 2024. (b) Armed forces conflict death: This question resolves as **YES** if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

P.title: Will these AI labs launch a mechanism to enable users to understand if content is generated by their AIs before July 1, 2024? (Meta)
P.body: For each AI lab, this question resolves as **YES** if the lab publicly releases a tool to check if some text, audio, or visual content is generated by their AI models before July 1, 2024.

metadata.background_info:
On July 21, 2023, the White House announced ([fact sheet](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2023/07/21/fact-sheet-biden-harris-administration-secures-voluntary-commitments-from-leading-artificial-intelligence-companies-to-manage-the-risks-posed-by-ai/), [full report](https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Ensuring-Safe-Secure-and-Trustworthy-AI.pdf)) that Amazon, Anthropic, Google, Inflection, Meta, Microsoft, and OpenAI have voluntarily committed to manage AI risks.

The voluntary commitments are in three categories (a) "Ensuring Products are Safe Before Introducing Them to the Public", (b) "Building Systems that Put Security First", and (c) "Earning the Public’s Trust", and are "designed to advance a generative AI legal and policy regime".

In this last category, one commitment is to "Develop and deploy mechanisms that enable users to understand if audio or visual content is AI-generated, including robust provenance, watermarking, or both, for AI-generated audio or visual content." This question asks whether this commitment is met in the specified time frame.

OpenAI has [worked on such a watermarking tool](https://techcrunch.com/2022/12/10/openais-attempts-to-watermark-ai-text-hit-limits/), in part devised by computing researcher Scott Aaronson, but has not released such a tool publicly as required for this question.

Q.title: Before June 6, 2024, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

metadata.background_info:
China has escalated military tensions with Taiwan, launching [large-scale military drills](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/05/22/world/asia/china-taiwan-drills.html) around the island starting on May 23, 2024. These drills were described by China as "punishment" for what it considers separatist acts by Taiwan, and mark a significant test for Taiwan's newly inaugurated leader, [Lai Ching-te](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/5/20/william-lai-ching-te-takes-oath-to-become-taiwans-new-president), who assumed office on May 20, 2024. 

Initial phases of the exercises involved dozens of Chinese fighter jets, destroyers, frigates, and missile speedboats conducting mock strikes against Taiwanese military targets.

reasons: The development of AI transparency tools may be influenced by geopolitical tensions, including the relationship between China and Taiwan. If tensions escalate, AI labs might prioritize transparency to mitigate misinformation about conflicts.
Understanding the implications of AI-generated content could be crucial during times of conflict, as misinformation can exacerbate tensions and lead to misunderstandings.
There may be public interest in both AI accountability and international relations, making this combination relevant for those monitoring developments in both fields.
relevance.conclusion: The logical combination of these questions is worth considering due to the potential interplay between AI transparency and geopolitical events.

P.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

Q_given_P.title: Given "Deadpool & Wolverine" has a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, will Disney announce a new night parade for Magic Kingdom by D23 2024?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box office openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013). This information is reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page.

Then, will Disney announce a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World, Florida, at or before D23 2024? The resolution will be YES if Disney announces a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024. It will be NO if no new night time parade is announced by the end of the convention or if Disney announces that an existing parade is moving to Florida. The question will close on August 8 and resolve at the end of the convention, unless an announcement is made prior, in which case it will close as soon as possible after the announcement.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) "Deadpool & Wolverine" domestic box office opening exceeds $185,548,391 (b) Disney announces a new night parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024?
P_and_Q.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

(b) This will resolve YES if Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. It will be resolved NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention. It will also resolve NO if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. This will close August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention (unless it is announced prior to the convention, in which case it will close as soon as I can after the announcement).

P.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

metadata.background_info:
**Deadpool & Wolverine** is an upcoming blockbuster by Marvel Studios scheduled to be released on July 26, 2024 featuring the two iconic heroes from the X-Men Universe.

The recent projection from Deadline puts the domestic opening to [$160-$165 million](https://deadline.com/2024/07/deadpool-wolverine-box-office-opening-projection-1236000799/), which would not only be the best opening year-to-date (beating **Inside Out 2** with $154 million) but also a record start for an R-rated movie. 

Another projection from June was even higher, [at $200+ million](https://deadline.com/2024/06/deadpool-wolverine-box-office-projection-1235973545/).

The ticket seller Fandango [reported on May 21](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/deadpool-and-wolverine-has-strongest-day-one-ticket-pre-sales-in-franchise-history-at-fandango/1100-6523599/) that their ticket pre-sales for the movie were the site's biggest ones in 2024 up to date.

Q.title: Will Disney announce a new night parade for the Magic Kingdom park at or before D23 2024?
Q.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. It will be resolved NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention. It will also resolve NO if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. This will close August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention (unless it is announced prior to the convention, in which case it will close as soon as I can after the announcement).

content.text: This will resolve YES if Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. It will be resolved NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention. It will also resolve NO if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. This will close August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention (unless it is announced prior to the convention, in which case it will close as soon as I can after the announcement).

reasons: Both questions relate to major entertainment events, which could be of interest to the same audience, such as moviegoers and theme park enthusiasts.

The success of a movie's box office performance may influence Disney's decisions regarding new attractions or events, as they often consider current trends and audience interests when planning new offerings.
There could be a correlation between the popularity of the Deadpool franchise and the potential for new announcements from Disney, as they might aim to capitalize on high-profile releases.
relevance.conclusion: The logical combination is worth considering due to potential interrelations between entertainment trends and audience engagement.

P.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

Q_given_P.title: Given that at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics, will Mathieu van der Poel finish ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race in Paris?
Q_given_P.body:
This question addresses the outcome of the Men's Olympic Road Race in Paris. It resolves to YES if Mathieu van der Poel ranks higher than Wout van Aert. If both do not finish, the one who gives up first is ranked lower. If both give up due to the same crash or do not start, this market resolves 50%/50%.

The condition for this question is that at least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources. The race will start on August 3rd at 11:00 a.m. and will resolve after the race.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Olympics: (a) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal and (b) Mathieu van der Poel finishes ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race?
P_and_Q.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions); and (b) Mathieu van der Poel ranks higher than Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race. If both do not finish, the one who gives up first is ranked lower. If both give up due to the same crash or do not start, this market resolves 50%/50%. The Men's Olympic Road Race starts on August 3rd at 11:00 a.m. and will resolve after the race.

P.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.background_info:
[Gold medal wins at the Summer Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All-time_Olympic_Games_medal_table) are concentrated in a small number of countries; the United States alone has won nearly 20% of every gold medal ever awarded, and a total of eight countries account for the majority of medalists.

Conversely, prior to the opening of the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, there are over 100 National Olympic Committees that have never won a gold medal. In recent Games, the number of countries that won their first gold were:

* London 2012: 3
* Rio de Janeiro 2016: 9
* Tokyo 2020: 3

Will this number be 5 or more this year?

Q.title: Will Mathieu van der Poel finish ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race in Paris?
Q.body:
This market resolves to YES if Mathieu van der Poel ranks higher than Wout van Aert. If both do not finish, the one who gives up first is ranked lower. If both give up due to the same crash or do not start, this market resolves 50%/50%.

This market will close when the Men's Olympic Road Race starts on August 3rd at 11:00 a.m. and will resolve after the race.

content.text: This market resolves to YES if Mathieu van der Poel ranks higher than Wout van Aert. If both do not finish, the one who gives up first is ranked lower. If both give up due to the same crash or do not start, this market resolves 50%/50%.
This market will close when the Men's Olympic Road Race starts on August 3rd at 11:00 a.m. and will resolve after the race.

reasons: The performance of individual athletes in events like the Men's Olympic Road Race could be influenced by the overall success of their countries in the Olympics, including the potential for debut gold medals.

Countries that are winning their first gold medals may have athletes competing in various events, including cycling, which could create a narrative around national pride and performance during the Olympics.
relevance.conclusion: It makes sense to consider the logical combination of these questions as they are both related to the outcomes of the same event (the Olympics) and could be influenced by each other.

P.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
P.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on ISS advising against Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Given this, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if ISS advises against either Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, before August 1, 2024, any of the following occur according to official statements or credible reports: 
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If none of these events occur before the specified date, then the question resolves as NO.

P_and_Q.title: Will BOTH of the following occur: (1) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advises Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk, AND (2) diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
P_and_Q.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if BOTH of the following conditions are met:

1. Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors.

2. Before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves as **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

P.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
P.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
Elon Musk is the current CEO of Tesla and owns around 13% of the company. During its founding years in 2003 - 2005, Musk invested heavily into the company, eventually becoming chair of the board of directors and one of the largest shareholders; he subsequently became CEO in October 2008. His success at the company has seen Tesla become the 17th largest company in the world by market cap with its share price soaring since its June 2010 IPO.

As a result of his immense success as CEO, a $56 billion pay package to Musk was approved by Tesla's board of the directors in 2018. However, Musk has yet to receive this package, as per the [FT](https://www.ft.com/content/8d823cef-543a-4d33-afa0-c68f081842d1):

>Tesla’s board has been lobbying investors to re-ratify the $56bn award given in 2018, which was struck down by a Delaware judge in January due to concerns over its size and the independence of the board. In response, Musk vowed to leave the state and move Tesla’s incorporation to Texas.

>Tesla chair Robyn Denholm has argued that Musk deserves to be paid so much because the company hit ambitious targets for revenue and its stock price. She brushed off criticism she is too close to the CEO as “crap”.

Aside from the sheer size of the pay package - the largest of its kind - those who oppose it call into question various decisions made by Musk during his tenure as CEO. In particular,  Musk's social media activity has been called into question, and perhaps most notably the:

- Purchase - and subsequent rebrand - of Twitter (now X) for $44 billion which has attracted a lot of negative criticism and has also seen Musk spend a disproportionate amount of time at that company instead of Tesla.

 - Purchase of $1.5 billion of Bitcoin in 2021 and allowing the cryptocurrency to be used by customers for purchasing Tesla automobiles. The company promptly stopped accepting the currency - causing the price to plummet - after which Tesla announced they had sold almost all of their Bitcoin holdings at a loss.

During significant shareholder votes like this one, influential proxy advisory firms often send out advice to shareholders on what to vote and why. According to [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proxy_firm):

>A proxy firm provides services to shareholders (in most cases an institutional investor of some type) to vote their shares at shareholder meetings of, usually, listed companies.

The two largest proxy advisory firms are ISS and Glass Lewis. The latter has [advised](https://www.ft.com/content/8d823cef-543a-4d33-afa0-c68f081842d1) shareholders *not* to vote in favour of Musk's package as well as advising shareholders to vote against the re-election of Kimbal Musk - brother of Elon Musk - from the board of directors. The ISS, however, has yet to issue any advice with respect to the June 13 shareholder meeting.

---------------------

See related question:

[*Will a non-Disney-nominated board member be elected to Disney's board at the April 3, 2024, shareholder meeting?*](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/21972/non-disney-board-member-elected-april-2024/)

Q.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
Q.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
Recently, the national security advisor of the Philippines [called for the expulsion](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/philippine-calls-chinese-diplomats-be-expelled-disinformation-2024-05-10/) of Chinese diplomats over the leak of a telephone transcript between a Philippine admiral and Chinese officials, in which a Philippine admiral [informally agreed](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2024-05-07/china-threatens-to-release-audio-of-secret-deal-with-philippines) to certain terms about how the  Philippine Navy would resupply its personnel stationed in disputed areas.  

China and the Philippines have [overlapping claims](https://www.cfr.org/global-conflict-tracker/conflict/territorial-disputes-south-china-sea) to islands in the South China Sea, and in the past several months tensions have been increasing, with China [using](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/south-china-sea-why-are-china-philippines-tensions-heating-up-2024-04-11/) water cannons, collision and ramming tactics, and even a military-grade laser to try to stop the Philippines from resupplying its naval outposts. 

For further background please see [Philippines Considers Expelling Chinese Diplomats After Leaked Transcript](https://hotair.com/john-s-2/2024/05/10/philippines-considers-expelling-chinese-diplomats-after-leaked-audio-n3788194).

reasons: There may be concerns about the impact of corporate governance decisions at Tesla on investor sentiment, which could influence international relations and diplomatic actions, especially if Tesla is a significant player in the Philippines or China.

The political landscape surrounding corporate governance and international relations can intersect, particularly if there are economic ties between Tesla and the countries involved, making it relevant to consider both questions together.
relevance.conclusion: The logical combination of these questions makes sense due to potential intersections between corporate governance and international relations.

P.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5?
P.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

Q_given_P.title: If the strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, has a K-index greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, the strongest geomagnetic storm has a Planetary K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product. Then, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The highest K-index must be greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5 during the specified period.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: The Republican Party must win the special election for OH's 6th district as reported by credible sources. If sources disagree, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, the strongest geomagnetic storm will have a K-index greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5, and (2) The Republican Party will retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
P_and_Q.body: (1) This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product. (2) This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

P.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5?
P.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

metadata.background_info:
In May 2024, sunspot region AR3664, now designated as AR3697, returned to face Earth after merging with another active sunspot region, resulting in numerous M- and X-class solar flares that caused intense [geomagnetic storms and auroras](https://earthsky.org/earth/auroras-last-night-extreme-solar-storm-wow-millions-may-10-11-12-2024/) visible at unusually low latitudes. 

As AR3697 [returns to face Earth](https://www.space.com/return-aurora-causing-sunspot-june-solar-storm-prospects) in early June 2024, space weather forecasters anticipate ongoing geomagnetic activity and are closely monitoring the region's continued potential to produce extreme space weather. 

[Sunspots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunspot) are areas of intense magnetic activity that often give rise to solar flares and coronal mass ejections (CMEs), which can disturb Earth's magnetosphere and impact satellite operations, power grids, and navigation systems.

The [K-index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-index), which measures fluctuations in Earth's magnetic field, ranges from from 0 to 9. The NOAA Space Weather Scales uses the Kp values to classify the severity of geomagnetic storms from G1 (minor) to G5 (extreme), equating to Kp values of 5 to 9, respectively.

Q.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

metadata.background_info:
In early January 2024, Rep. Bill Johnson communicated to the Governor of Ohio that he would be vacating his congressional seat effective of the 21st of January 2024 in order to take up position as the 10th President of Youngstown State University. 

On the 4th of January, [Governor DeWine announced ] (https://governor.ohio.gov/media/news-and-media/governor-dewine-calls-special-election-for-ohios-6th-congressional-district) that the special election process was scheduled as followed: partisan primary elections will happen on the 19th of March, and the general election will happen on the 11th June 2024.

reasons: Geomagnetic storms can impact technology and infrastructure, which may influence voter behavior or political campaigning strategies, making the outcomes of both questions potentially interrelated.
Severe geomagnetic storms can disrupt communication and power systems, which could affect the timing and conduct of elections, including the special election in Ohio.

The political climate surrounding elections can be influenced by natural events, and understanding the relationship between geomagnetic storms and political outcomes could provide insights into voter sentiment.
relevance.conclusion: It makes sense to consider the logical combination of these questions due to the potential interconnections between natural phenomena and political events.

P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

Q_given_P.title: Given Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, will Anthropic launch a mechanism to enable users to understand if content is generated by their AIs before July 1, 2024?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of the Democratic Party for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, is it true that Anthropic will publicly release a tool to check if some text, audio, or visual content is generated by their AI models before July 1, 2024?

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (b) Anthropic launches a mechanism to enable users to understand if content is generated by their AIs before July 1, 2024?
P_and_Q.body:
(a) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this part will resolve as **No**.

(b) This part of the question resolves as **YES** if Anthropic publicly releases a tool to check if some text, audio, or visual content is generated by their AI models before July 1, 2024.

P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
As of June 29, 2024, [Joe Biden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Biden?useskin=vector), the 46th and current president of the United States, is the presumptive nominee of the Democratic Party for the [2024 presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_presidential_election?useskin=vector), in which he faces a rematch against former president and current Republican presumptive nominee Donald Trump.

On June 27 2024, [the first presidential debate of the 2024 cycle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_presidential_debates?useskin=vector#June_27_presidential_debate_(Atlanta)) was held in Atlanta. Biden and Trump were the only candidates to qualify for the debate, and both participated. 

Biden's performance was widely panned by the media; variously termed an ['unmitigated disaster'](https://news.sky.com/story/in-command-trump-and-stumbling-biden-face-off-in-first-presidential-debate-13160193), a ['catastrophe'](https://www.thedailybeast.com/why-bidens-debate-catastrophe-was-months-in-the-making), and ['disqualifying'](https://www.newshub.co.nz/home/world/2024/06/us-election-debate-democrats-scramble-to-contain-fallout-after-biden-s-disqualifying-performance-against-trump.html), and it led to calls, including from the Editorial Boards of the [New York Times](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/28/opinion/biden-election-debate-trump.html) and the [Atlanta Journal-Constitution](https://www.newsweek.com/ajc-georgia-largest-newspaper-joe-biden-exit-race-immediately-1919206), for Biden to abandon his bid for a second term. 

In [the betting market](https://electionbettingodds.com/) and on Metaculus, [Biden's perceived chances of winning re-election](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/11245/winner-of-2024-us-presidential-election/), and of [remaining the Democratic Party's nominee](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/11379/2024-democrat-nominee-for-us-prez/), tumbled in the aftermath of the debate. 

As of June 29 2024, [the Biden campaign's position](https://www.thedailybeast.com/biden-campaign-emphatic-he-will-not-drop-out-after-debate-disaster) is that Biden will not drop out of the race, and major Democratic Party figures including former president [Barack Obama](https://x.com/BarackObama/status/1806758633230709017) and current vice president [Kamala Harris have defended the president](https://www.newsweek.com/kamala-harris-defends-joe-biden-debate-1918553) on the basis that one poor showing in a debate does not negate the overall success of his first term.

On June 28, Biden acknowledged his poor performance in the debate, but [defended his re-election bid](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/us/politics/2024/06/28/democrats-urge-joe-biden-drop-out-election/):

>On Friday afternoon, Mr Biden insisted in a defiant speech in North Carolina he could still win the election but told supporters: “I know I’m not a young man…I don’t debate as well as I used to.

>“I give you my word as a Biden [that] I would not be running again if I didn’t believe with all my heart and soul I can do this job. Quite frankly, the stakes are too high.”

Q.title: Will these AI labs launch a mechanism to enable users to understand if content is generated by their AIs before July 1, 2024? (Anthropic)
Q.body: For each AI lab, this question resolves as **YES** if the lab publicly releases a tool to check if some text, audio, or visual content is generated by their AI models before July 1, 2024.

metadata.background_info:
On July 21, 2023, the White House announced ([fact sheet](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2023/07/21/fact-sheet-biden-harris-administration-secures-voluntary-commitments-from-leading-artificial-intelligence-companies-to-manage-the-risks-posed-by-ai/), [full report](https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Ensuring-Safe-Secure-and-Trustworthy-AI.pdf)) that Amazon, Anthropic, Google, Inflection, Meta, Microsoft, and OpenAI have voluntarily committed to manage AI risks.

The voluntary commitments are in three categories (a) "Ensuring Products are Safe Before Introducing Them to the Public", (b) "Building Systems that Put Security First", and (c) "Earning the Public’s Trust", and are "designed to advance a generative AI legal and policy regime".

In this last category, one commitment is to "Develop and deploy mechanisms that enable users to understand if audio or visual content is AI-generated, including robust provenance, watermarking, or both, for AI-generated audio or visual content." This question asks whether this commitment is met in the specified time frame.

OpenAI has [worked on such a watermarking tool](https://techcrunch.com/2022/12/10/openais-attempts-to-watermark-ai-text-hit-limits/), in part devised by computing researcher Scott Aaronson, but has not released such a tool publicly as required for this question.

reasons: The announcement of Biden not seeking re-election could influence public discourse and perceptions about AI ethics and transparency, especially in an election year where technology plays a significant role.
There could be a relationship between political decisions and technological advancements, as shifts in leadership may prompt changes in regulatory or ethical standards for AI development.
Both events are time-sensitive and occur within a similar timeframe, making them relevant for stakeholders monitoring political and technological landscapes.
relevance.conclusion: It makes sense to consider the logical combination of these questions due to the potential interconnections between political announcements and advancements in AI transparency.

P.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
P.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

Q_given_P.title: If Joe Biden is still president at the end of July 2024, will Gamestop's market cap be higher than Docusign's on June 28th, 2024?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. Then, on Friday, June 28, 2024, will CompaniesMarketCap show a greater market cap for Gamestop than for Docusign, when checked by Metaculus after 4:00 PM EDT (8:00 PM UTC)?

Resolution Criteria:
- For the condition: Joe Biden must be officially president at the specified time.
- For the outcome: Resolves as **Yes** if CompaniesMarketCap shows a greater market cap for Gamestop than Docusign at the specified time. Resolves as **No** if Docusign's market cap is greater.

P_and_Q.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024 and will Gamestop's market capitalization be higher than Docusign's on June 28, 2024?
P_and_Q.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following are true: (a) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States. (b) On Friday, June 28, 2024, CompaniesMarketCap shows a greater market cap for Gamestop than Docusign, when checked by Metaculus after 4:00 PM EDT (8:00 PM UTC). Gamestop's page can be accessed [here](https://companiesmarketcap.com/gamestop/marketcap/), and Docusign's page can be accessed [here](https://companiesmarketcap.com/docusign/marketcap/).

P.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
P.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

content.text: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

Q.title: On June 28th, 2024, will Gamestop's market capitalization be higher than Docusign's, according to CompaniesMarketCap?
Q.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, on Friday June 28, 2024, CompaniesMarketCap shows a greater market cap for Gamestop than Docusign, when checked by Metaculus after 4:00 PM EDT (8:00 PM UTC). If CompaniesMarketCap shows a greater market cap for Docusign than Gamestop, this question resolves as **No**.

- Gamestop's page can be accessed [here](https://companiesmarketcap.com/gamestop/marketcap/).
- Docusign's page can be accessed [here](https://companiesmarketcap.com/docusign/marketcap/).

metadata.background_info:
According to its [annual report](https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1326380/000132638024000012/gme-20240203.htm), Gamestop is a specialty retailer with 4,169 physical stores, offering games, entertainment products and technology. In the year ended December 31, 2023, it made $6.7 million in net income with $5.27 billion in revenues. Its revenues were *down* 11% year over year.

According to its [annual report](https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1261333/000126133324000045/docu-20240131.htm), Docusign offers contract lifecycle management software and the world's leading electronic signature product. In the year ended January 31, 2024, it made $73.98 million in net income with $2.76 million in revenues. Its revenues were *up* 9.8% year over year. 

As of June 18, 2024, CompaniesMarketCap reported a market capitalization of $10.52 billion for GameStop compared with $10.43 billion for DocuSign.

See Also

Fox Business: [GameStop meme stock mania is SEC’s bad dream on repeat | GameStop shares have advanced over 100% this quarter](https://www.foxbusiness.com/markets/gamestop-meme-stock-mania-secs-bad-dream-repeat)

AP: [Gamestop shares slump following annual shareholder meeting](https://apnews.com/article/gamestop-stock-annual-shareholder-meeting-db6785418358f3446e343d1b6647604d)

reasons: Both questions pertain to significant events in 2024, making them relevant for investors and political analysts who are interested in the interplay between political stability and market performance.
The outcome of Biden's presidency could influence market sentiment, which might affect the stock performance of companies like Gamestop and Docusign.
Market participants might want to assess the likelihood of political events impacting stock valuations, making the logical combination of these questions worthwhile.
relevance.conclusion: It makes sense to consider the logical combination of these questions as they relate to significant events in 2024 that could influence each other.

P.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
P.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on the same nation winning more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: At the 2024 Olympics, the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins more than one women's team sport. In this scenario, will the Fidesz-KDNP alliance maintain its plurality in the European Parliament from Hungary in 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the Olympic condition: The condition is met if the same NOC wins gold in at least two of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. If eight different NOCs win these events, the condition is not met.

Resolution criteria for the Fidesz-KDNP outcome: Resolves "Yes" if the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition in the 2024 European Parliament elections, maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats, according to credible sources.

P_and_Q.title: Will a single nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics and will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
P_and_Q.body: This question resolves as Yes only if both of the following occur: (a) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics (association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo), and (b) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

P.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
P.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

metadata.background_info:
Although most events in the Summer Olympics are contested by individual athletes, or small teams of 2-4, a few have one single larger team representing their entire country. These are:

Association football
Basketball 5×5
Basketball 3×3
Field hockey
Handball
Rugby sevens
Volleyball
Water polo

(Beach volleyball is listed on the source but excluded from the question because two teams from each team can qualify, unlike the other sports.)

Will the women's teams of the same nation win at least two of these sports?

Q.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

metadata.background_info:
The Fidesz-KDNP alliance has long been a dominant political force in Hungary, championed by Viktor Orbán's Fidesz and the Christian Democratic People's Party (KDNP). Since 2005, they have secured a significant majority of Hungary's seats in the European Parliament, capitalizing on shared conservative and nationalistic ideologies. 

However, the alliance faces [new challenges](https://apnews.com/article/hungary-orban-eu-election-magyar-fidesz-russia-f53cd35e52a9f91c34b00d8dd6f85694) as Péter Magyar, a former insider of the Fidesz party, breaks ranks and forms his own party, Tisztelet és Szabadság (Respect and Freedom). Magyar's emergence comes at a time when Fidesz is grappling with scandals and a loss of public trust, highlighted by significant resignations within its ranks.

The 2024 European Parliament elections are critical for the alliance as they face increasing internal and EU-wide challenges, including economic pressures and debates over the EU's influence on national policies. These elections will test the alliance's ability to maintain its influence amid growing political diversity and opposition within Hungary.

reasons: Both questions pertain to events occurring in 2024, which may lead to discussions about national performance and international standing.

The success of a nation in women's team sports at the Olympics could influence its political climate and public sentiment, potentially impacting voter behavior and support for parties like Fidesz-KDNP.
A strong showing at the Olympics could bolster national pride and support for the ruling party, which might correlate with their performance in the European Parliament elections.
relevance.conclusion: It makes sense to consider the logical combination of these questions, as there are plausible connections between national sports success and political outcomes.

P.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

Q_given_P.title: Given Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election, will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, meaning he is not elected for any constituency. Then, will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as Yes if Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. Credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate will be used for resolution.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves to Yes if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory within the specified time frame, officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or confirmed by credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Actions by proxy forces will not count.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024?
P_and_Q.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. A "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting, including airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces will not count.

P.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

metadata.background_info:
[Rishi Sunak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rishi_Sunak?useskin=vector), born 12 May 1980, is a British politician who has served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party since 2022. Sunak has been Member of Parliament for [Richmond (Yorks)](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Richmond_(Yorks)_(UK_Parliament_constituency)&useskin=vector) since 2015.

In the most recent general election in 2019, [Sunak won his seat](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Richmond_(Yorks)_(UK_Parliament_constituency)&useskin=vector#Elections_in_the_2010s) with 63.6% of the vote; the nearest competitor was the Labour Party candidate on 16.4% of the vote. 

Since 2019 the Conservative Party, in power since 2010, has seen a significant decline in its support according to [opinion polling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2024_United_Kingdom_general_election?useskin=vector#Graphical_summary); and as of late May 2024, it trails the opposition Labour Party by around 20 points. 

[Sunak's personal approval rating](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leadership_approval_opinion_polling_for_the_2024_United_Kingdom_general_election?useskin=vector) has been in negative territory for nearly his entire tenure as Prime Minister, and is [among the worst for any British Conservative or Labour leader](https://www.ipsos.com/en-uk/rishi-sunaks-satisfaction-falls-equal-worst-ever-ipsos-rating-conservative-or-labour-leader) in Ipsos data going back to 1978.

In May 2024 [Sunak called a snap general election](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-69050450), to be held on July 4.

Sunak is expected to contest the constituency of [Richmond and Northallerton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richmond_and_Northallerton_(UK_Parliament_constituency)?useskin=vector) in the July 4 election, which was created following the [2023 Periodic Review of Westminster constituencies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2023_Periodic_Review_of_Westminster_constituencies?useskin=vector).

Q.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
Q.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

reasons: Rishi Sunak's political decisions and the UK government's stance could influence international relations, including tensions with Iran.

Political instability in the UK could lead to changes in military engagement or responses from Iran.
relevance.conclusion: The logical combination of these questions is relevant due to the potential interconnections between UK politics and international military actions.

P.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
P.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

Q_given_P.title: Given at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
Q_given_P.body: Suppose the following is true: At least 30% of respondents in the July 2024 Manifold poll agree that weak AGI has been achieved. The poll does not define 'AGI' and asks respondents to vote based on their own understanding, with 'no opinion' responses ignored. The poll resolves YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is at least 0.3. Given this, will at least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early? The letter must be signed by at least 20 Democratic caucus members before the end of Sunday, July 21st, or multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures will also suffice. If these criteria are not met, the outcome is NO.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, and (2) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
P_and_Q.body:
(1) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024: Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

(2) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.
