relevance.conclusion: While the two questions pertain to different domains (sports and music), there are cultural and temporal connections that might make the logical combination interesting to some audiences.

P.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on the US government ending its agreement with Verisign for .com management, will JD Vance say "Couch" before August?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The US government ends its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024. This means that before this date, the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain.

Then, is it true that J.D. Vance will publicly mention the word "Couch" before August 2024? Specifically, will he mention "Couch" between July 25, 5:30 PM ET and July 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? This includes any verbal or written usage of "Couch", including pluralization or possessive forms, through J.D. Vance's social media or official communication channels, but not through @SenVancePress. Videos posted outside this timeframe do not qualify.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, and (b) JD Vance say "Couch" before August 1, 2024?
P_and_Q.body:
(a) The US government will end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this condition is not met.

(b) JD Vance will have said "Couch" if he publicly mentions the word "Couch" between July 25, 5:30 PM ET and July 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this condition. A 'mention' includes:
- A verbal usage of the word "Couch".
- Any written usage of the word "Couch" published through J.D. Vance's social media or other official communication channels regardless of capitalization (@JDVance would qualify however @SenVancePress will not count).
Videos posted on his social media which were filmed outside this market's time frame will not qualify for a "Yes" resolution.

P.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
[Verisign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Verisign) operates the authoritative registry for the .com generic top-level domain (TLD) under a registry agreement with the Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN) and a [Cooperative Agreement](https://www.ntia.gov/page/verisign-cooperative-agreement) with the US Department of Commerce (DOC). This means it is the wholesale provider of the .com TLD to every domain name registrar. The American Economic Liberties Projected [has called](https://www.economicliberties.us/press-release/ntia-and-doj-must-break-verisigns-monopoly-power-over-domain-names-advocates-urge/) this arrangement a "government-designated monopoly over domain registration." According to [The American Prospect](https://prospect.org/power/2024-06-27-government-created-most-profitable-company-verisign/):

>You have probably never heard of the most profitable company in America, and possibly the world. It’s a government-granted monopoly that feasts on high margins for a low-dollar administrative product. Today, three advocacy groups pressured the Biden administration to take down the rules in place that enable this gravy train.

>The company is called VeriSign [*sic*], and it has exclusive control of the registration system for the .com domain name. Every year, hundreds of millions of website owners pay VeriSign [*sic*] a small annual fee to keep their .com in working order. Every year, the cost of managing the database to make sure that .com websites work either stays flat or goes down, while the fee for registering a .com website goes up.

The Cooperative Agreement between Verisign and the US DOC will automatically renew for a six-year term unless the DOC provides notice of non-renewal on August 2, 2024.

According to [Bloomberg](https://archive.ph/IXZ3V#selection-1705.0-1726.0), during the 2018 renewal the Trump Administration lifted the cap on wholesale prices for *.com*. The antitrust advocacy groups have written to the Justice Department to withdraw guidance that allowed the elimination of price caps in the 2018 renewal, with the letters citing President Biden’s 2021 [executive order](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/presidential-actions/2021/07/09/executive-order-on-promoting-competition-in-the-american-economy/) on competition.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on Cyprus qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will ISS advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?

Q.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
Q.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
Elon Musk is the current CEO of Tesla and owns around 13% of the company. During its founding years in 2003 - 2005, Musk invested heavily into the company, eventually becoming chair of the board of directors and one of the largest shareholders; he subsequently became CEO in October 2008. His success at the company has seen Tesla become the 17th largest company in the world by market cap with its share price soaring since its June 2010 IPO.

As a result of his immense success as CEO, a $56 billion pay package to Musk was approved by Tesla's board of the directors in 2018. However, Musk has yet to receive this package, as per the [FT](https://www.ft.com/content/8d823cef-543a-4d33-afa0-c68f081842d1):

>Tesla’s board has been lobbying investors to re-ratify the $56bn award given in 2018, which was struck down by a Delaware judge in January due to concerns over its size and the independence of the board. In response, Musk vowed to leave the state and move Tesla’s incorporation to Texas.

>Tesla chair Robyn Denholm has argued that Musk deserves to be paid so much because the company hit ambitious targets for revenue and its stock price. She brushed off criticism she is too close to the CEO as “crap”.

Aside from the sheer size of the pay package - the largest of its kind - those who oppose it call into question various decisions made by Musk during his tenure as CEO. In particular,  Musk's social media activity has been called into question, and perhaps most notably the:

- Purchase - and subsequent rebrand - of Twitter (now X) for $44 billion which has attracted a lot of negative criticism and has also seen Musk spend a disproportionate amount of time at that company instead of Tesla.

 - Purchase of $1.5 billion of Bitcoin in 2021 and allowing the cryptocurrency to be used by customers for purchasing Tesla automobiles. The company promptly stopped accepting the currency - causing the price to plummet - after which Tesla announced they had sold almost all of their Bitcoin holdings at a loss.

During significant shareholder votes like this one, influential proxy advisory firms often send out advice to shareholders on what to vote and why. According to [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proxy_firm):

>A proxy firm provides services to shareholders (in most cases an institutional investor of some type) to vote their shares at shareholder meetings of, usually, listed companies.

The two largest proxy advisory firms are ISS and Glass Lewis. The latter has [advised](https://www.ft.com/content/8d823cef-543a-4d33-afa0-c68f081842d1) shareholders *not* to vote in favour of Musk's package as well as advising shareholders to vote against the re-election of Kimbal Musk - brother of Elon Musk - from the board of directors. The ISS, however, has yet to issue any advice with respect to the June 13 shareholder meeting.

---------------------

See related question:

[*Will a non-Disney-nominated board member be elected to Disney's board at the April 3, 2024, shareholder meeting?*](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/21972/non-disney-board-member-elected-april-2024/)

relevance.conclusion: While the topics are quite different, there are potential indirect connections in terms of public interest and the events of 2024 that could make the logical combination intriguing for certain audiences.

Q.title: Will Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
Q.body: This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

metadata.background_info:
The 2024 presidential election in Iran is set for June 28, following the [sudden death](https://apnews.com/article/iran-president-ebrahim-raisi-426c6f4ae2dd1f0801c73875bb696f48) of President Ebrahim Raisi in a helicopter crash on May 19. In the wake of Raisi's death, Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei [appointed](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/5/20/irans-khamenei-confirms-mohammad-mokhber-as-interim-president) First Vice President Mohammad Mokhber as interim head of government and mandated a snap election within 50 days.

Iran's [Guardian Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guardian_Council), a 12-member body responsible for (among other functions) vetting electoral candidates, plays a crucial role in Iran’s political landscape. Comprising six members appointed by the Supreme Leader and six nominated by the head of the judiciary (also appointed by the Supreme Leader), the Council has a history of disqualifying reformist and moderate candidates.

[Mahmoud Ahmadinejad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mahmoud_Ahmadinejad), who served as Iran's president from 2005 to 2013, has registered as a candidate in the snap election. His tenure was marked by controversy with Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, and he was subsequently disqualified by the Guardian Council from running in the 2017 and 2021 elections. 

The Guardian Council has [indicated](https://iranwire.com/en/politics/130202-irans-guardian-council-aims-to-speed-up-vetting-of-presidential-candidates/) that it will announce its list of approved candidates on June 11.

reasons: Both questions pertain to significant political and sports events that could reflect broader trends in their respective countries.

The outcome of the Copa America match could have implications for Uruguay's national pride and international standing, which may be of interest to political analysts in relation to national identity and sociopolitical stability.
The inclusion of candidates like Ahmadinejad could influence public sentiment and voter turnout, which might intersect with national morale reflected in sports performances.
relevance.conclusion: While the two questions are from different domains, they touch on themes of national representation and public sentiment, making their logical combination somewhat relevant.

Q.title: Will these AI labs publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024? (Inflection)
Q.body: For each AI lab, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

metadata.background_info:
On July 21, 2023, the White House announced ([fact sheet](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2023/07/21/fact-sheet-biden-harris-administration-secures-voluntary-commitments-from-leading-artificial-intelligence-companies-to-manage-the-risks-posed-by-ai/), [full report](https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Ensuring-Safe-Secure-and-Trustworthy-AI.pdf)) that Amazon, Anthropic, Google, Inflection, Meta, Microsoft, and OpenAI have voluntarily committed to manage AI risks.

The voluntary commitments are in three categories (a) "Ensuring Products are Safe Before Introducing Them to the Public", (b) "Building Systems that Put Security First", and (c) "Earning the Public’s Trust", and are "designed to advance a generative AI legal and policy regime".

From [Microsoft](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/openai/concepts/red-teaming), "historically described systematic adversarial attacks for testing security vulnerabilities. With the rise of LLMs, the term has extended beyond traditional cybersecurity and evolved in common usage to describe many kinds of probing, testing, and attacking of AI systems." Note that this question only asks about _safety_, not _security_. [Google](https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/6625378258649088/google-and-alphabet-vulnerability-reward-program-vrp-rules) and [OpenAI](https://bugcrowd.com/openai) already have bug bounties for security.

reasons: The performance of athletes in events like the men's 100m dash can be influenced by technological advancements, including AI and data analysis in training and performance evaluation.

The interest in AI safety and transparency could be heightened around major events like the Olympics, potentially leading to more reports being published as a way to demonstrate responsible AI usage during a high-profile period.
relevance.conclusion: While the two questions are from vastly different domains, there exists a contextual relevance due to the potential influence of AI on sports performance and the heightened focus on AI safety during significant events like the Olympics.

P.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6?
P.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

P_and_Q.body:
(a) This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.
(b) This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

P.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

metadata.background_info:
In May 2024, sunspot region AR3664, now designated as AR3697, returned to face Earth after merging with another active sunspot region, resulting in numerous M- and X-class solar flares that caused intense [geomagnetic storms and auroras](https://earthsky.org/earth/auroras-last-night-extreme-solar-storm-wow-millions-may-10-11-12-2024/) visible at unusually low latitudes. 

As AR3697 [returns to face Earth](https://www.space.com/return-aurora-causing-sunspot-june-solar-storm-prospects) in early June 2024, space weather forecasters anticipate ongoing geomagnetic activity and are closely monitoring the region's continued potential to produce extreme space weather. 

[Sunspots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunspot) are areas of intense magnetic activity that often give rise to solar flares and coronal mass ejections (CMEs), which can disturb Earth's magnetosphere and impact satellite operations, power grids, and navigation systems.

The [K-index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-index), which measures fluctuations in Earth's magnetic field, ranges from from 0 to 9. The NOAA Space Weather Scales uses the Kp values to classify the severity of geomagnetic storms from G1 (minor) to G5 (extreme), equating to Kp values of 5 to 9, respectively.

Q.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

metadata.background_info:
In early January 2024, Rep. Bill Johnson communicated to the Governor of Ohio that he would be vacating his congressional seat effective of the 21st of January 2024 in order to take up position as the 10th President of Youngstown State University. 

On the 4th of January, [Governor DeWine announced ] (https://governor.ohio.gov/media/news-and-media/governor-dewine-calls-special-election-for-ohios-6th-congressional-district) that the special election process was scheduled as followed: partisan primary elections will happen on the 19th of March, and the general election will happen on the 11th June 2024.

reasons: Both questions pertain to events occurring in the same timeframe (July 2024), which may interest individuals tracking significant occurrences during that period.

There could be a broader interest in understanding the relationship between natural phenomena (like geomagnetic storms) and political events, as extreme weather or space weather could influence human activities, including voting behavior or election outcomes.
Researchers or forecasters might be interested in how external factors, such as geomagnetic storms, could potentially affect the political landscape or voter turnout.
relevance.conclusion: The logical combination of these questions is somewhat relevant, as they both occur in the same timeframe and could be of interest to those studying the intersection of natural phenomena and political events.

Q_given_P.title: Given Anthropic publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Then, will Disney announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition (P):
- The question resolves as YES if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q):
- Resolves YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024.
- Resolves NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23.
- Resolves NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere.
- Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Anthropic publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, and (b) Disney announces a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?
P_and_Q.body: (a) Anthropic must publish a public report by June 30, 2024, with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (b) Disney must announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. The announcement must not be in a "spitballing ideas" sense, and it must be specifically for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida, not any other park. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention, and it will be resolved after the convention.

P.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
P.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, will MISS JUSTIFY finish in front of STRIKER HAS DIAL in the Wilton Stakes?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024. This means that before that date, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this condition is not met.

Given this condition, will MISS JUSTIFY finish in front of STRIKER HAS DIAL in the Wilton Stakes at Saratoga on July 12th? The head-to-head (H2H) horse racing market will resolve YES if MISS JUSTIFY finishes in front of STRIKER HAS DIAL. If there is a dead heat or if either horse scratches, the market resolves to NO. Results will be published at https://www.equibase.com/.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, and (b) MISS JUSTIFY finishing in front of STRIKER HAS DIAL in the Wilton Stakes on July 12th?
P_and_Q.body:
For this question to resolve as Yes, both of the following must occur:

(a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls must take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024. This involves any of the following events occurring, according to official statements or credible reports:
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.
   If none of these events are reported before the specified date, this part resolves as No.

(b) In the Wilton Stakes on July 12th, MISS JUSTIFY must finish in front of STRIKER HAS DIAL. If there is a dead heat or if either horse scratches, this part resolves as No.

Only if both (a) and (b) resolve as Yes, will this combined question resolve as Yes.

Q.title: Will at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
Q.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.background_info:
[Medal wins at the Summer Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All-time_Olympic_Games_medal_table) are concentrated in a fairly small number of countries; the United States alone has won about 1 out of every 6 medals ever awarded, and a total of ten countries account for the majority of medalists.

Conversely, prior to the opening of the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, there are about 60 National Olympic Committees that have never won a gold medal; the most recent countries to win their first medal, in the Tokyo 2020 Games, were Burkina Faso, San Marino and Turkmenistan.

Will at least 5 new countries win their first medal at the current Games?

reasons: The popularity of Taylor Swift and the Deadpool franchise may attract attention from a diverse audience, including sports fans who are also interested in the Olympics.
There may be a cultural or media event surrounding both questions, such as a significant promotion or marketing campaign that connects entertainment and sports events.
The timing of both events (the movie release and the Olympics) could lead to discussions about celebrity involvement in sports, potentially influencing public interest in both.
relevance.conclusion: While the two questions are from different domains (entertainment and sports), there are potential cultural connections that could make their logical combination interesting to some audiences.

[Medal wins at the Summer Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All-time_Olympic_Games_medal_table) are concentrated in a fairly small number of countries; the United States alone has won about 1 out of every 6 medals ever awarded, and a total of ten countries account for the majority of medalists.

Conversely, prior to the opening of the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, there are about 60 National Olympic Committees that have never won a gold medal; the most recent countries to win their first medal, in the Tokyo 2020 Games, were Burkina Faso, San Marino and Turkmenistan.

Will at least 5 new countries win their first medal at the current Games?

P.title: Which of these countries will qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? (Israel)
P.body: This question will resolve immediately as **Yes** for countries that participate in a Semi-final and are then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other countries, the question will resolve as **No**.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on Israel qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will OpenAI launch a mechanism to identify AI-generated content before July 1, 2024?
Q_given_P.body:
This question explores the relationship between two distinct events: Israel's qualification for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and OpenAI's release of a content identification tool.

Condition details: Israel must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for this condition to be met.

Outcome details: OpenAI must publicly release a tool to check if text, audio, or visual content is generated by their AI models before July 1, 2024, for the outcome to resolve as YES.

(b) OpenAI will launch a mechanism to enable users to understand if content is generated by their AIs before July 1, 2024: This question resolves as **YES** if OpenAI publicly releases a tool to check if some text, audio, or visual content is generated by their AI models before July 1, 2024. P.title: Which of these countries will qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? (Israel)
P.body: This question will resolve immediately as **Yes** for countries that participate in a Semi-final and are then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other countries, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
The Eurovision Song Contest 2024 is set to take place in Malmö, Sweden, following the country's victory at the 2023 contest. The contest will be held at the Malmö Arena, and will consist of two semi-finals on 7 and 9 May, and a final on 11 May 2024.

Of the 37 participating countries, 6 are guaranteed to participate in the final: The hosting country (Sweden) and the "Big Five" countries (United Kingdom, France, Germany, Italy and Spain). The remaining 31 countries will have to compete in the Semi-finals. In each Semi-final, 10 countries will qualify for the final, and the rest will not.

More information can be found on [Wikipedia](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/21827/countries-in-eurovision-2024-final/)

See also: [How the Eurovision Song Contest works](https://eurovision.tv/about/how-it-works)

Q.title: Will these AI labs launch a mechanism to enable users to understand if content is generated by their AIs before July 1, 2024? (OpenAI)
Q.body: For each AI lab, this question resolves as **YES** if the lab publicly releases a tool to check if some text, audio, or visual content is generated by their AI models before July 1, 2024.

metadata.background_info:
On July 21, 2023, the White House announced ([fact sheet](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2023/07/21/fact-sheet-biden-harris-administration-secures-voluntary-commitments-from-leading-artificial-intelligence-companies-to-manage-the-risks-posed-by-ai/), [full report](https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Ensuring-Safe-Secure-and-Trustworthy-AI.pdf)) that Amazon, Anthropic, Google, Inflection, Meta, Microsoft, and OpenAI have voluntarily committed to manage AI risks.

The voluntary commitments are in three categories (a) "Ensuring Products are Safe Before Introducing Them to the Public", (b) "Building Systems that Put Security First", and (c) "Earning the Public’s Trust", and are "designed to advance a generative AI legal and policy regime".

In this last category, one commitment is to "Develop and deploy mechanisms that enable users to understand if audio or visual content is AI-generated, including robust provenance, watermarking, or both, for AI-generated audio or visual content." This question asks whether this commitment is met in the specified time frame.

OpenAI has [worked on such a watermarking tool](https://techcrunch.com/2022/12/10/openais-attempts-to-watermark-ai-text-hit-limits/), in part devised by computing researcher Scott Aaronson, but has not released such a tool publicly as required for this question.

reasons: Both questions involve events that will be resolved in the near future, making them timely and relevant for forecasters.
The outcome of the Eurovision event may influence public sentiment or media coverage, which could indirectly affect discussions around AI transparency and user understanding.
There may be a cultural connection between the Eurovision event and the AI labs, especially if the event garners significant media attention that promotes discussions about AI.
relevance.conclusion: While the questions are from different domains, there are potential indirect connections in terms of timing and public interest, making the logical combination somewhat relevant.

P.title: Will South Africa elect a president before July 1, 2024?
P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources.

metadata.background_info:
South Africa's 2024 national election, held on May 29, is highly contested, with the long-ruling African National Congress (ANC) potentially losing its majority in Parliament for the first time in 30 years. The president of South Africa is elected by Parliament, specifically the National Assembly, requiring a simple majority of 201 out of 400 lawmakers. Due to the [ANC's declining support](https://apnews.com/article/south-africa-election-president-vote-bb5529f8ec76f40f0bebdff67bfd2320), coalition talks are anticipated, which could delay the election of the president.

The results of the national election held on May 29, 2024, are expected to be announced by the Independent Electoral Commission (IEC) by the Sunday following the election, and the new Parliament [must hold its first session within 14 days of the announcement of the election results](https://apnews.com/article/south-africa-election-president-vote-bb5529f8ec76f40f0bebdff67bfd2320).

P.title: Will these AI labs publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024? (Google Deep Mind)
P.body: For each AI lab, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on Google Deep Mind publishing a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm between July 1 and July 28, 2024, have a K-index greater than 6 and less than or equal to 7?
Q_given_P.body:
For Google Deep Mind, the condition resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

The outcome resolves as the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 1 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive), according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product. Resolves YES if the K-index is greater than 6 and less than or equal to 7, and NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

P_and_Q.body: (a) For Google Deep Mind, this resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (b) For the geomagnetic storm, this resolves as **YES** if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 1 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive), is greater than 6 and less than or equal to 7, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

metadata.background_info:
On July 21, 2023, the White House announced ([fact sheet](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2023/07/21/fact-sheet-biden-harris-administration-secures-voluntary-commitments-from-leading-artificial-intelligence-companies-to-manage-the-risks-posed-by-ai/), [full report](https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Ensuring-Safe-Secure-and-Trustworthy-AI.pdf)) that Amazon, Anthropic, Google, Inflection, Meta, Microsoft, and OpenAI have voluntarily committed to manage AI risks.

The voluntary commitments are in three categories (a) "Ensuring Products are Safe Before Introducing Them to the Public", (b) "Building Systems that Put Security First", and (c) "Earning the Public’s Trust", and are "designed to advance a generative AI legal and policy regime".

From [Microsoft](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/openai/concepts/red-teaming), "historically described systematic adversarial attacks for testing security vulnerabilities. With the rise of LLMs, the term has extended beyond traditional cybersecurity and evolved in common usage to describe many kinds of probing, testing, and attacking of AI systems." Note that this question only asks about _safety_, not _security_. [Google](https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/6625378258649088/google-and-alphabet-vulnerability-reward-program-vrp-rules) and [OpenAI](https://bugcrowd.com/openai) already have bug bounties for security.

Q.title: Between July 1 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 6 and less than or equal to 7?
Q.body: This question resolves as the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 1 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive), according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

metadata.background_info:
In May 2024, sunspot region AR3664, now designated as AR3697, returned to face Earth after merging with another active sunspot region, resulting in numerous M- and X-class solar flares that caused intense [geomagnetic storms and auroras](https://earthsky.org/earth/auroras-last-night-extreme-solar-storm-wow-millions-may-10-11-12-2024/) visible at unusually low latitudes. 

As AR3697 [returns to face Earth](https://www.space.com/return-aurora-causing-sunspot-june-solar-storm-prospects) in early June 2024, space weather forecasters anticipate ongoing geomagnetic activity and are closely monitoring the region's continued potential to produce extreme space weather. 

[Sunspots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunspot) are areas of intense magnetic activity that often give rise to solar flares and coronal mass ejections (CMEs), which can disturb Earth's magnetosphere and impact satellite operations, power grids, and navigation systems.

The [K-index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-index), which measures fluctuations in Earth's magnetic field, ranges from from 0 to 9. The NOAA Space Weather Scales uses the Kp values to classify the severity of geomagnetic storms from G1 (minor) to G5 (extreme), equating to Kp values of 5 to 9, respectively.

reasons: The publication of AI safety reports could influence public and governmental awareness regarding safety concerns, which may in turn affect the focus on environmental issues such as geomagnetic storms.
There may be a correlation between increased awareness of AI safety and a societal response to natural phenomena, potentially affecting preparedness for geomagnetic storms.
relevance.conclusion: While the two questions are not directly related, there are potential indirect connections through societal awareness and response to safety and environmental issues.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on the men's 100m dash winning time breaking the Olympic record at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics, will the EPP hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

Q.title: Which political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (EPP)
Q.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** for the political group that holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

metadata.background_info:
The [European Parliament](https://www.citizensinformation.ie/en/government_in_ireland/european_government/eu_institutions/european_parliament.html#:~:text=The%20European%20Parliament%20is%20part,member%20states%20every%205%20years.) is a key legislative body within the European Union (EU) that shares lawmaking responsibilities with the Council of the European Union. Comprising [705](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/news/en/faq/11/how-many-meps) directly elected Members of the European Parliament (MEPs) from EU member states, the Parliament holds elections every five years. While it cannot initiate legislation, the European Parliament can approve, reject, or amend proposed laws, and it also supervises EU institutions and budgets.

During [European parliamentary elections](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/at-your-service/en/be-heard/elections), candidates run as representatives of their national parties, which are typically affiliated with political groups in the European Parliament. Once elected, Members of the European Parliament (MEPs) officially join political groups based on shared ideologies and policy objectives that align with their national parties. According to the [EU Parliament website](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/about-parliament/en/organisation-and-rules/organisation/political-groups), the following political groups are currently present in the European parliament:

| Group Name | Abbreviation |
|------------|--------------|
| Group of the European People's Party (Christian Democrats) | EPP |
| Group of the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats in the European Parliament | S&D |
| Renew Europe Group | RE |
| Group of the Greens/European Free Alliance | Greens/EFA |
| Identity and Democracy Group | ID |
| European Conservatives and Reformists Group | ECR |
| The Left group in the European Parliament  | GUE/NGL |

In the [2019 elections](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/election-results-2019/en), the seats were allocated as follows between the political groups: 

| Group Name | Abbreviation | Seats |
|------------|--------------|-------|
| Group of the European People's Party (Christian Democrats) | EPP | 182 |
| Group of the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats in the European Parliament | S&D | 154 |
| Renew Europe Group | RE | 108 |
| Group of the Greens/European Free Alliance | Greens/EFA | 74 |
| Identity and Democracy Group | ID | 73 |
| European Conservatives and Reformists Group | ECR | 62 |
| Non-Inscrits | NI | 57 |
| Confederal Group of the European United Left - Nordic Green Left | GUE/NGL | 41 |
| **Total Seats** | | **751** |


The next European parliamentary elections are [scheduled for 2024](https://multimedia.europarl.europa.eu/en/package/european-elections-2024_23001), with [polling](https://europeelects.eu/ep2024/) indicating a narrow lead for the EPP in early 2023.

reasons: The men's 100m dash winning time could be indirectly influenced by the global political climate, which may affect funding and support for athletics and sports programs in various countries, including those participating in the Olympics.
The European Parliamentary Elections may affect policies that influence sports funding or international relations, which could have an impact on the performance of athletes from different countries.
People interested in sports and politics may find the intersection of these two events intriguing, as they represent significant global happenings in 2024.
relevance.conclusion: While there are potential indirect connections between the outcomes of these two events, they are largely independent and may not warrant a logical combination for eliciting probabilities.

[Google](https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/6625378258649088/google-and-alphabet-vulnerability-reward-program-vrp-rules) and [OpenAI](https://bugcrowd.com/openai) already have bug bounties for security.

Q.title: Will Poland win the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship?
Q.body: This question will resolve Yes if Poland is the winner of the WTC 2024 as announced on the official site or the official social media of the organisation.

metadata.background_info:
Warhammer 40,000 is a miniature wargame produced by Games Workshop. Set in the far future, players collect, assemble, and paint miniature figures representing warriors, creatures, and vehicles from various factions. Players then pit their armies against each other on a tabletop battlefield. Warhammer 40,000 is currently the [most popular](https://icv2.com/print/article/56556) miniature wargame in the world.

Each year, the World Team Championship (WTC) is organized, where 8-player teams from around the world compete against each other. The teams are separated into 4 seeding groups based on past performance. In the group stage of the tournament, 10 groups are formed with 4 teams each (one from each seeding group). Group stage performance determines the overall ranking among teams, which then compete in a further 4 games following a [Swiss format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swiss-system_tournament). The team with the most total points from the group and Swiss stages is crowned the winner.

This year, the WTC takes place in Mechelen, Belgium from August 8th to 11th. 40 national teams are competing, including 5 first-time competitors: Andorra, China, Mexico, Singapore/Thailand, and South Korea. The full list of teams and seeding groups can be found [here](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=847246644093139). Past performance can be found [here](https://worldteamchampionship.com/about/history/).

reasons: The outcomes of AI safety reports may influence the gaming community's perception of Poland's gaming strategies or reputation, potentially affecting their performance in competitive events.

There may be a correlation between the success of AI labs in safety measures and the overall technological landscape, which could indirectly impact competitive gaming through advancements in AI-assisted training or strategies.
relevance.conclusion: The logical combination of these questions is somewhat tenuous but could be of interest to those examining broader cultural or technological trends.

P.title: Will a journalist or an opposition politician be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico, before June 15, 2024?
P.body:
The question will be resolved as **YES** if [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt.

Alternatively, the resolution will also be **YES** if relevant Slovak institutions (e.g., the public prosecutor's office, courts, police, and similar authorities) issue a statement to that effect.

Otherwise, the question will be resolved as **NO**.

Then, will one of the following individuals be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.

Resolution for Q: YES if any listed Trump family member is the nominee. NO otherwise.

P_and_Q.body:
(a) The question will be resolved as **YES** if credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024. Alternatively, the resolution will also be **YES** if relevant Slovak institutions (e.g., the public prosecutor's office, courts, police, and similar authorities) issue a statement to that effect. P.title: Will a journalist or an opposition politician be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico, before June 15, 2024?
P.body:
The question will be resolved as **YES** if [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt.

Alternatively, the resolution will also be **YES** if relevant Slovak institutions (e.g., the public prosecutor's office, courts, police, and similar authorities) issue a statement to that effect.

Otherwise, the question will be resolved as **NO**.

metadata.background_info:
On May 15th, Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico (SMER-SD party) was targeted in an [assassination attempt](https://apnews.com/article/slovakia-prime-minister-shooting-fico-23faba11c0f371ef0f69a34861337ae0) after leaving a governmental meeting in the town of Handlová. The assailant, Juraj Cintula, managed to fire at least five bullets from very close proximity before being subdued. Prime Minister Fico was urgently taken to the hospital; his [condition](https://www.cbsnews.com/miami/news/slovakia-prime-minister-robert-fico-shot/?intcid=CNR-02-0623) remains serious but stable.

Just a few hours after the attack, the Deputy Chairman of the Slovak Parliament, Ľuboš Blaho (SMER-SD party), in an emotional speech, blamed the ["liberal media"](https://www.irozhlas.cz/zpravy-svet/nejvetsi-radikalove-vladni-koalice-obvinili-z-atentatu-na-fica-media-a-opozici_2405151955_jgr) and the political opposition for inciting the shooter. Concurrently, Andrej Danko, leader of the SNS party, which is a member of the ruling coalition, echoed this sentiment.

Robert Kaliňák, the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Defence, has been the most prominent figure in the aftermath, with his statements also targeting the media and political opposition.

Outgoing Slovak President Zuzana Čaputová and newly elected President Peter Pellegrini have called for societal calm and are orchestrating a [meeting](https://www.ceskenoviny.cz/zpravy/caputova-a-pellegrini-vyzvali-k-opusteni-bludneho-kruhu-nenavisti/2519316) with all major political entities in Slovakia, scheduled for May 21. However, so far, all governmental parties have either not responded or declined the invitation.

To date, apart from the shooter, only one individual has been charged in connection with the assassination attempt, and it was for spreading online hate. Paradoxically, despite the framing by the governmental politicians, the shooter was no fan of the liberal opposition and reportedly also a member of the recently disbanded ["Slovenskí Branci"](https://www.euronews.com/2024/05/15/what-is-known-about-suspect-allegedly-involved-in-shooting-of-robert-fico) paramilitary group, which had ties to Russia.

metadata.background_info:
Donald John Trump is the 45th and current president of the United States. Before entering politics, he was a businessman and television personality. Trump won a surprise victory in the [2016 presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2016_United_States_presidential_election), and sought re-election in the [2020 presidential election.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_United_States_presidential_election)

The [Trump family](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Family_of_Donald_Trump) has a net worth reported to be in the single-digit billions, and is now one of the most prominent families in Republican politics. Trump has several adult children, and there is speculation that a Trump political dynasty may emerge in the coming years, with both [Donald Trump Jr. and Ivanka Trump suggested as possible contenders for the presidency.](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/jan/04/donald-trump-jr-ivanka-trump-2024-presidential-election-poll)

reasons: The political climate in Slovakia and the US could intersect, especially if the assassination attempt has broader implications for international relations or political dynamics that might affect the Republican nomination process.
Media coverage of the assassination attempt could influence public perception and political discourse, potentially shaping the narrative around the Trump family and their candidacy.
The timing of events in Slovakia could impact the Republican primaries, especially if charges lead to heightened political tensions or shifts in public opinion.
relevance.conclusion: While the two questions are about different political contexts, there could be indirect connections through media influence, public perception, and political dynamics that warrant consideration of their logical combination.

metadata.background_info:
In May 2024, sunspot region AR3664, now designated as AR3697, returned to face Earth after merging with another active sunspot region, resulting in numerous M- and X-class solar flares that caused intense [geomagnetic storms and auroras](https://earthsky.org/earth/auroras-last-night-extreme-solar-storm-wow-millions-may-10-11-12-2024/) visible at unusually low latitudes. 

As AR3697 [returns to face Earth](https://www.space.com/return-aurora-causing-sunspot-june-solar-storm-prospects) in early June 2024, space weather forecasters anticipate ongoing geomagnetic activity and are closely monitoring the region's continued potential to produce extreme space weather. 

[Sunspots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunspot) are areas of intense magnetic activity that often give rise to solar flares and coronal mass ejections (CMEs), which can disturb Earth's magnetosphere and impact satellite operations, power grids, and navigation systems.

The [K-index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-index), which measures fluctuations in Earth's magnetic field, ranges from from 0 to 9. The NOAA Space Weather Scales uses the Kp values to classify the severity of geomagnetic storms from G1 (minor) to G5 (extreme), equating to Kp values of 5 to 9, respectively.

reasons: The value of USD against JPY might influence economic activities, which could indirectly relate to the frequency or intensity of geomagnetic storms affecting technology and infrastructure.
Investors and traders might be interested in both financial markets and environmental factors, looking for correlations between currency fluctuations and natural events.
Both questions pertain to significant events in 2024, making it relevant to assess their potential interdependence.
relevance.conclusion: While the two questions seem unrelated at first glance, there could be underlying economic or environmental factors that connect them, making the logical combination of these questions worth considering.

P.title: Will Blake Lively's "It Ends With Us" outgross her husband Ryan Reynold's "Deadpool & Wolverine" this weekend?
P.body:
Resolution 

This market resolves YES "It Ends with Us" has a higher (domestic) gross than "Deadpool & Wolverine" for the weekend of August 9-11. 

Source: The "weekend" tab in BoxOfficeMojo, for August 9-11.

I will use the number listed by BoxOfficeMojo, however it is defined (e.g. typically 3-day FSS wekeend + previews).

Example: last weekend, the "Deadpool & Wolverine" grossed $96.8M, far ahead of the "Trap", which opened to $15.4M.

Context 

"Deadpool & Wolverine" has been crushing the box office, and is expected to repeat with its 3rd weekend at #1. 

The potential long shot that could dethrone it is "It Ends With Us", the adaptation of Colleen Hoover's mega-bestseller, starring (funnily enough) Ryan Reynold's wife, Blake Lively.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question will resolve based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, with the question resolving YES if the lead is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3. If the condition is not met, the question resolves N/A.

A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Q.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
Q.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

metadata.background_info:
On June 27, 2024, Joe Biden and Donald Trump held their first debate as part of the campaign for the 2024 presidential election. Biden's debate performance was [widely seen as poor](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/biden-trump-june-debate-poll/), and prompted calls for Biden to drop out, including [from the New York Times editorial board](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/28/opinion/biden-election-debate-trump.html) and, as of July 5, [three House Democrats](https://thehill.com/homenews/house/4755497-seth-moulton-biden-presidential-race/).

The Biden team has reportedly been [taking action](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/04/politics/biden-rising-tide-pressure-reelection-bid-analysis/index.html) to reverse recent perceptions, and has [so far insisted](https://thehill.com/homenews/campaign/4754840-biden-campaign-denies-dropout-rumors/) that Biden will not be dropping out. However, the New York Times [reported](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/07/03/us/politics/biden-withdraw-election-debate.html) that the Biden team has internally acknowledged that they must turn perceptions around quickly.

According to [538's presidential polling average](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) (when accessed on July 5, 2024), on the date of the debate Trump held a +0.2 percentage point lead in the polling averages, which has since widened to a +2.4 percentage point lead for Trump reported for July 5. The near-term polling trend may be critical as Biden weighs whether to stay in the race ahead of the [2024 Democratic National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Democratic_National_Convention), which is scheduled to be held August 19th through the 22nd.

reasons: The box office success of Blake Lively's film could be influenced by the political climate and public sentiment, which may also affect polling numbers for Trump and Biden.
Cultural events like movie releases may have indirect effects on political engagement or sentiment, making it interesting to explore correlations between entertainment and politics.
relevance.conclusion: While there may be some tangential connections between the two questions, they are largely unrelated and may not yield valuable insights when combined.

metadata.background_info:
The Eurovision Song Contest 2024 is set to take place in Malmö, Sweden, following the country's victory at the 2023 contest. The contest will be held at the Malmö Arena, and will consist of two semi-finals on 7 and 9 May, and a final on 11 May 2024.

Of the 37 participating countries, 6 are guaranteed to participate in the final: The hosting country (Sweden) and the "Big Five" countries (United Kingdom, France, Germany, Italy and Spain). The remaining 31 countries will have to compete in the Semi-finals. In each Semi-final, 10 countries will qualify for the final, and the rest will not.

More information can be found on [Wikipedia](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/21827/countries-in-eurovision-2024-final/)

See also: [How the Eurovision Song Contest works](https://eurovision.tv/about/how-it-works)

P.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
P.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Q.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
Q.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
Brazilian pole vaulter Thiago Braz set the Olympic record for the men's pole vault at 6.03m at the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympics. Since then, the world record [has risen to 6.24m](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Men%27s_pole_vault_world_record_progression), set by Swedish athlete Armand Duplantis earlier in 2024. In 2020, his only chance so far to break the Olympic record, the Swede did succeed at his 6.19m WR attempt, though he had already won gold with 6.02m.

With Braz suspended from the current Games on account of doping, will his record be broken by the dominant world record holder, or maybe by another competitor?

The men's pole vault [is scheduled](https://olympics.com/en/paris-2024/schedule/athletics/men-s-pole-vault?day=3-august) to begin August 3, 2024.

reasons: The outcome of Joe Biden dropping out could influence the media landscape and the focus of coverage during the Olympics, potentially affecting the timing of reporting on various sports events.
If Biden's dropout occurs close to the Olympics, media outlets may prioritize coverage of political events over sports, which could impact the likelihood of reporting on pole vault records.

There could be a cultural or public interest crossover where political events and major sports events are discussed in tandem, leading to speculation on how political events might overshadow sports news.
relevance.conclusion: While there are some connections between the two questions, they are relatively weak, and the logical combination does not present a strong case for relevance.

P.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
P.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution criteria for P: The question resolves Yes if ISS releases a statement explicitly advising against either of these actions. Otherwise, it resolves No.

Then, is it true that Greece will qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

P_and_Q.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if BOTH of the following occur: (1) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors, AND (2) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. P.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
P.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
Elon Musk is the current CEO of Tesla and owns around 13% of the company. During its founding years in 2003 - 2005, Musk invested heavily into the company, eventually becoming chair of the board of directors and one of the largest shareholders; he subsequently became CEO in October 2008. His success at the company has seen Tesla become the 17th largest company in the world by market cap with its share price soaring since its June 2010 IPO.

As a result of his immense success as CEO, a $56 billion pay package to Musk was approved by Tesla's board of the directors in 2018. However, Musk has yet to receive this package, as per the [FT](https://www.ft.com/content/8d823cef-543a-4d33-afa0-c68f081842d1):

>Tesla’s board has been lobbying investors to re-ratify the $56bn award given in 2018, which was struck down by a Delaware judge in January due to concerns over its size and the independence of the board. In response, Musk vowed to leave the state and move Tesla’s incorporation to Texas.

>Tesla chair Robyn Denholm has argued that Musk deserves to be paid so much because the company hit ambitious targets for revenue and its stock price. She brushed off criticism she is too close to the CEO as “crap”.

Aside from the sheer size of the pay package - the largest of its kind - those who oppose it call into question various decisions made by Musk during his tenure as CEO. In particular,  Musk's social media activity has been called into question, and perhaps most notably the:

- Purchase - and subsequent rebrand - of Twitter (now X) for $44 billion which has attracted a lot of negative criticism and has also seen Musk spend a disproportionate amount of time at that company instead of Tesla.

 - Purchase of $1.5 billion of Bitcoin in 2021 and allowing the cryptocurrency to be used by customers for purchasing Tesla automobiles. The company promptly stopped accepting the currency - causing the price to plummet - after which Tesla announced they had sold almost all of their Bitcoin holdings at a loss.

During significant shareholder votes like this one, influential proxy advisory firms often send out advice to shareholders on what to vote and why. According to [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proxy_firm):

>A proxy firm provides services to shareholders (in most cases an institutional investor of some type) to vote their shares at shareholder meetings of, usually, listed companies.

The two largest proxy advisory firms are ISS and Glass Lewis. The latter has [advised](https://www.ft.com/content/8d823cef-543a-4d33-afa0-c68f081842d1) shareholders *not* to vote in favour of Musk's package as well as advising shareholders to vote against the re-election of Kimbal Musk - brother of Elon Musk - from the board of directors. The ISS, however, has yet to issue any advice with respect to the June 13 shareholder meeting.

---------------------

See related question:

[*Will a non-Disney-nominated board member be elected to Disney's board at the April 3, 2024, shareholder meeting?*](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/21972/non-disney-board-member-elected-april-2024/)

metadata.background_info:
The Eurovision Song Contest 2024 is set to take place in Malmö, Sweden, following the country's victory at the 2023 contest. The contest will be held at the Malmö Arena, and will consist of two semi-finals on 7 and 9 May, and a final on 11 May 2024.

Of the 37 participating countries, 6 are guaranteed to participate in the final: The hosting country (Sweden) and the "Big Five" countries (United Kingdom, France, Germany, Italy and Spain). The remaining 31 countries will have to compete in the Semi-finals. In each Semi-final, 10 countries will qualify for the final, and the rest will not.

More information can be found on [Wikipedia](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/21827/countries-in-eurovision-2024-final/)

See also: [How the Eurovision Song Contest works](https://eurovision.tv/about/how-it-works)

reasons: The outcome of the ISS advisory on Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election may influence investor sentiment and Tesla's stock performance, which could impact the financial landscape and potentially the countries participating in Eurovision, particularly if there are significant financial implications for sponsors or the event itself.

There may be an interest in the intersection of corporate governance (as represented by ISS's advisory) and cultural events like Eurovision, particularly in contexts where corporate sponsors have a stake in the event's success or where public sentiment towards a company can affect its sponsorship of such events.
relevance.conclusion: The logical combination of these questions is somewhat relevant, particularly in a broader context of corporate influence on cultural events, but it may not be a common or pressing inquiry.

P.title: Will Disney announce a new night parade for the Magic Kingdom park at or before D23 2024?
P.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. It will be resolved NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention. It will also resolve NO if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. This will close August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention (unless it is announced prior to the convention, in which case it will close as soon as I can after the announcement).

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on Disney announcing a new night parade for Magic Kingdom park at or before D23 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm between July 1 and July 28, 2024, have a K-index greater than 7 and less than or equal to 8?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Disney announces a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida at or before D23 2024. The announcement must be for a new parade, not the relocation of an existing one such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night. The announcement must occur before the end of D23 2024, and this will close on August 8 unless an announcement is made sooner.

Given this condition, we are interested in whether the strongest geomagnetic storm between July 1 and July 28, 2024, will have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 7 and less than or equal to 8. The K-index will be determined by the highest Planetary K-index according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Disney announces a new night parade for the Magic Kingdom park at or before D23 2024, and (2) the strongest geomagnetic storm between July 1 and July 28, 2024, has a K-index ("Kp") greater than 7 and less than or equal to 8?
P_and_Q.body:
(1) Disney will resolve YES if they announce at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. It will resolve NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention. It will also resolve NO if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. This will close August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention (unless it is announced prior to the convention, in which case it will close as soon as possible after the announcement).

(2) The geomagnetic storm question resolves based on the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 1 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive), according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

Q.title: Between July 1 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 7 and less than or equal to 8?
Q.body: This question resolves as the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 1 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive), according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

metadata.background_info:
In May 2024, sunspot region AR3664, now designated as AR3697, returned to face Earth after merging with another active sunspot region, resulting in numerous M- and X-class solar flares that caused intense [geomagnetic storms and auroras](https://earthsky.org/earth/auroras-last-night-extreme-solar-storm-wow-millions-may-10-11-12-2024/) visible at unusually low latitudes. 

As AR3697 [returns to face Earth](https://www.space.com/return-aurora-causing-sunspot-june-solar-storm-prospects) in early June 2024, space weather forecasters anticipate ongoing geomagnetic activity and are closely monitoring the region's continued potential to produce extreme space weather. 

[Sunspots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunspot) are areas of intense magnetic activity that often give rise to solar flares and coronal mass ejections (CMEs), which can disturb Earth's magnetosphere and impact satellite operations, power grids, and navigation systems.

The [K-index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-index), which measures fluctuations in Earth's magnetic field, ranges from from 0 to 9. The NOAA Space Weather Scales uses the Kp values to classify the severity of geomagnetic storms from G1 (minor) to G5 (extreme), equating to Kp values of 5 to 9, respectively.

reasons: Both questions pertain to events occurring in 2024, which may be of interest to those tracking significant happenings that year.
Individuals interested in Disney events might also be curious about natural phenomena that could affect travel plans, such as geomagnetic storms.
There may be a niche audience interested in the interplay between entertainment events and natural events, especially if they are planning trips to Disney around that time.
relevance.conclusion: While the two events are quite different, there are potential overlaps in audience interest, particularly for those planning visits to Disney during the timeframe of the geomagnetic storm. However, the direct relevance is limited.

Q.title: Will these AI labs publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024? (Meta)
Q.body: For each AI lab, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

metadata.background_info:
On July 21, 2023, the White House announced ([fact sheet](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2023/07/21/fact-sheet-biden-harris-administration-secures-voluntary-commitments-from-leading-artificial-intelligence-companies-to-manage-the-risks-posed-by-ai/), [full report](https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Ensuring-Safe-Secure-and-Trustworthy-AI.pdf)) that Amazon, Anthropic, Google, Inflection, Meta, Microsoft, and OpenAI have voluntarily committed to manage AI risks.

The voluntary commitments are in three categories (a) "Ensuring Products are Safe Before Introducing Them to the Public", (b) "Building Systems that Put Security First", and (c) "Earning the Public’s Trust", and are "designed to advance a generative AI legal and policy regime".

From [Microsoft](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/openai/concepts/red-teaming), "historically described systematic adversarial attacks for testing security vulnerabilities. With the rise of LLMs, the term has extended beyond traditional cybersecurity and evolved in common usage to describe many kinds of probing, testing, and attacking of AI systems." Note that this question only asks about _safety_, not _security_. [Google](https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/6625378258649088/google-and-alphabet-vulnerability-reward-program-vrp-rules) and [OpenAI](https://bugcrowd.com/openai) already have bug bounties for security.

reasons: The performance of athletes at the Olympics could influence public perception and discussion about AI safety, potentially leading to more scrutiny and demands for transparency in AI labs.
There may be a psychological or cultural connection between the excitement of the Olympics and the public's interest in technological advancements, including AI.
Both questions concern events occurring in 2024, which might lead to a convergence of public attention and media coverage.
relevance.conclusion: While the two questions are from different domains, they could be seen as related through the lens of public interest and media attention in 2024, making the logical combination somewhat relevant.
