Q.title: Will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
Q.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** in the event that in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. 

Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

metadata.background_info:
[Nigel Paul Farage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigel_Farage?useskin=vector), born 3 April 1964, is a British politician who has served as the leader of [Reform UK](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reform_UK?useskin=vector) since June 2024, having previously been the leader of [UK Independence Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UK_Independence_Party) and the Brexit Party. Farage was a leading figure in the [Brexit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brexit?useskin=vector) movement.

In the [2024 UK general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_Kingdom_general_election?useskin=vector) to be held on July 4, Farage is contesting the constituency of [Clacton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clacton_(UK_Parliament_constituency)?useskin=vector) in Essex.

In the most recent general election in 2019, the Conservative Party candidate, Giles Watling, won the seat with 72.3% of the vote, and is standing for re-election. However, recent polling suggests that Farage is favoured to win the constituency. 

The Times: [Nigel Farage set to win Clacton ‘with biggest swing in modern history’](https://www.thetimes.com/uk/politics/article/farage-set-to-win-clacton-with-biggest-swing-in-modern-history-5tzjsmtw6)

>Nigel Farage is on course to win the Clacton seat with the biggest swing in modern electoral history, a new poll has suggested.

>The survey, commissioned by Arron Banks, a former Ukip donor, suggests that Farage will win 42 per cent of the vote in Clacton in Essex. The Tories are forecast to win 27 per cent and Labour 24 per cent.

>Survation, the company that carried out the survey, said the scale of the projected swing from the Tories to Reform would be “extremely rare” and “unprecedented in modern electoral history”.

reasons: Both questions pertain to significant events happening in 2024, which may interest sports and political analysts alike.
The outcomes of both events could potentially influence public sentiment and media coverage, as both Ronaldo and Farage are high-profile figures.
Interest in the intersection of sports and politics may lead to discussions about how public figures impact one another's domains.
relevance.conclusion: While the questions are from different domains (sports and politics), there is a potential interest in how public perception of one may influence the other, making the logical combination somewhat relevant.

P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
Q_given_P.body:
This question evaluates two independent events. 

Condition: Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. This is based on the chart as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Outcome: Taylor Swift must appear in the movie 'Deadpool and Wolverine' in any role, including voice roles. Confirmation of her appearance can come from independent sources, even if she is not credited on IMDB.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
P_and_Q.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden will be determined by 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. The question resolves if the lead is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4.

(b) Taylor Swift's cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine resolves YES if she appears in the movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. It will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is confirmed by independent sources.

P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

metadata.background_info:
On June 27, 2024, Joe Biden and Donald Trump held their first debate as part of the campaign for the 2024 presidential election. Biden's debate performance was [widely seen as poor](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/biden-trump-june-debate-poll/), and prompted calls for Biden to drop out, including [from the New York Times editorial board](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/28/opinion/biden-election-debate-trump.html) and, as of July 5, [three House Democrats](https://thehill.com/homenews/house/4755497-seth-moulton-biden-presidential-race/).

The Biden team has reportedly been [taking action](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/04/politics/biden-rising-tide-pressure-reelection-bid-analysis/index.html) to reverse recent perceptions, and has [so far insisted](https://thehill.com/homenews/campaign/4754840-biden-campaign-denies-dropout-rumors/) that Biden will not be dropping out. However, the New York Times [reported](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/07/03/us/politics/biden-withdraw-election-debate.html) that the Biden team has internally acknowledged that they must turn perceptions around quickly.

According to [538's presidential polling average](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) (when accessed on July 5, 2024), on the date of the debate Trump held a +0.2 percentage point lead in the polling averages, which has since widened to a +2.4 percentage point lead for Trump reported for July 5. The near-term polling trend may be critical as Biden weighs whether to stay in the race ahead of the [2024 Democratic National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Democratic_National_Convention), which is scheduled to be held August 19th through the 22nd.

metadata.background_info:
The [Tour de France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Tour_de_France) is an annual men's multiple stage bicycle race primarily held in France, while also occasionally passing through nearby countries. It is the most prestigious and most difficult bicycle race in the world. Q.title: Will Germany win the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship?
Q.body: This question will resolve Yes if Germany is the winner of the WTC 2024 as announced on the official site or the official social media of the organisation.

metadata.background_info:
Warhammer 40,000 is a miniature wargame produced by Games Workshop. Set in the far future, players collect, assemble, and paint miniature figures representing warriors, creatures, and vehicles from various factions. Players then pit their armies against each other on a tabletop battlefield. Warhammer 40,000 is currently the [most popular](https://icv2.com/print/article/56556) miniature wargame in the world.

Each year, the World Team Championship (WTC) is organized, where 8-player teams from around the world compete against each other. The teams are separated into 4 seeding groups based on past performance. In the group stage of the tournament, 10 groups are formed with 4 teams each (one from each seeding group). Group stage performance determines the overall ranking among teams, which then compete in a further 4 games following a [Swiss format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swiss-system_tournament). The team with the most total points from the group and Swiss stages is crowned the winner.

This year, the WTC takes place in Mechelen, Belgium from August 8th to 11th. 40 national teams are competing, including 5 first-time competitors: Andorra, China, Mexico, Singapore/Thailand, and South Korea. The full list of teams and seeding groups can be found [here](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=847246644093139). Past performance can be found [here](https://worldteamchampionship.com/about/history/).

relevance.conclusion: While the events are from different sports, there could be niche interest in their logical combination due to the shared context of competitive events, but the connection is weak.

P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on Individual Neutral Athletes winning ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will the strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, have a K-index greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6?
Q_given_P.body:
This question resolves as follows:

Condition: Individual Neutral Athletes must collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. If this condition is met before the end of the Games, it resolves immediately to "Yes".

Outcome: The strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, must have a highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product. Resolves YES if this is true, and NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

P_and_Q.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics AND will the strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, have a K-index greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6?
P_and_Q.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, as determined by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable. If they are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals before the end of the Games, this part resolves to "Yes" immediately. (2) The highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences' running 30-day history data product. If both conditions are met, the question resolves to "Yes"; otherwise, it resolves to "No".

P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

metadata.background_info:
As per the Olympic Committee’s [recommendations](https://olympics.com/ioc/news/strict-eligibility-conditions-in-place-as-ioc-eb-approves-individual-neutral-athletes-ains-for-the-olympic-games-paris-2024) from earlier this year, Russian and Belarusian athletes will be allowed to participate in the 2024 Games as long as they do so as so-called "Individual Neutral Athletes" (AINs), without an accompanying national flag or anthem.

The Russian Federation/Russian Olympic Committee has won an average of 19 gold medals in the last 3 Olympic Games, and Belarus has averaged  1.7.

Q.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6?
Q.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

metadata.background_info:
In May 2024, sunspot region AR3664, now designated as AR3697, returned to face Earth after merging with another active sunspot region, resulting in numerous M- and X-class solar flares that caused intense [geomagnetic storms and auroras](https://earthsky.org/earth/auroras-last-night-extreme-solar-storm-wow-millions-may-10-11-12-2024/) visible at unusually low latitudes. 

As AR3697 [returns to face Earth](https://www.space.com/return-aurora-causing-sunspot-june-solar-storm-prospects) in early June 2024, space weather forecasters anticipate ongoing geomagnetic activity and are closely monitoring the region's continued potential to produce extreme space weather. 

[Sunspots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunspot) are areas of intense magnetic activity that often give rise to solar flares and coronal mass ejections (CMEs), which can disturb Earth's magnetosphere and impact satellite operations, power grids, and navigation systems.

The [K-index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-index), which measures fluctuations in Earth's magnetic field, ranges from from 0 to 9. The NOAA Space Weather Scales uses the Kp values to classify the severity of geomagnetic storms from G1 (minor) to G5 (extreme), equating to Kp values of 5 to 9, respectively.

reasons: There may be interest in the potential effects of a geomagnetic storm on the performance of athletes, including Individual Neutral Athletes, due to disruptions in technology or psychological factors.
Researchers might be curious about the correlation between significant astronomical events and human performance in high-stakes competitions like the Olympics.
relevance.conclusion: The logical combination is somewhat interesting due to the potential interplay between sports performance and environmental factors, though it may not be a common inquiry.

P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
P.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

Q_given_P.title: Given Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024, will TCB Scans upload chapter 1122 of One Piece on August 1st?
Q_given_P.body:
This question combines two separate forecasting questions into a conditional format. 

Condition: The Fidesz-KDNP alliance must secure more seats than any other single party or coalition in the 2024 European Parliament elections, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament according to credible sources.

Outcome of interest: TCB Scans must upload chapter 1122 of One Piece on August 1st between 00:00:00 and 23:59:59 GMT-7. The resolution is based on whether the chapter is uploaded within this timeframe.

Background for the outcome: TCB Scans has a history of posting One Piece chapters on Thursdays, although recent uploads have shifted to Fridays following a Twitter account ban. This pattern may affect the upload schedule for chapter 1122.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024 and (b) TCB Scans upload chapter 1122 of One Piece on August 1st?
P_and_Q.body:
(a) This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

(b) This question will resolve to "Yes" if TCB Scans uploads chapter 1122 of One Piece on August 1st, 2024, between 00:00:00 and 23:59:59 GMT-7. TCB Scans usually posts the chapter on the Thursday before official release. Recent patterns of release days were: 1121, 1120, 1119, 1118, 1117, 1116, and 1115 were Thursdays, but there have been instances of Friday releases such as 1113 and 1112. Note that TCB has started posting on Fridays after the Twitter account ban, which may affect the release schedule.

P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
P.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

metadata.background_info:
The Fidesz-KDNP alliance has long been a dominant political force in Hungary, championed by Viktor Orbán's Fidesz and the Christian Democratic People's Party (KDNP). Since 2005, they have secured a significant majority of Hungary's seats in the European Parliament, capitalizing on shared conservative and nationalistic ideologies. 

However, the alliance faces [new challenges](https://apnews.com/article/hungary-orban-eu-election-magyar-fidesz-russia-f53cd35e52a9f91c34b00d8dd6f85694) as Péter Magyar, a former insider of the Fidesz party, breaks ranks and forms his own party, Tisztelet és Szabadság (Respect and Freedom). Magyar's emergence comes at a time when Fidesz is grappling with scandals and a loss of public trust, highlighted by significant resignations within its ranks.

The 2024 European Parliament elections are critical for the alliance as they face increasing internal and EU-wide challenges, including economic pressures and debates over the EU's influence on national policies. These elections will test the alliance's ability to maintain its influence amid growing political diversity and opposition within Hungary.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on Slovenia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will I earn a medal at the International Geography Championship?
Q_given_P.body:

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if I earn a medal at the International Geography Championship in Vienna, Austria, between July 13th and 21st, where gold, silver, and bronze all count as medals. Resolves NO otherwise.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Slovenia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 and (b) I earn a medal at the International Geography Championship?

(b) I will earn a medal at the International Geography Championship if I receive a gold, silver, or bronze medal during the event held from July 13th to 21st in Vienna, Austria, after performing well in the Chinese national championship.

P.title: Which of these countries will qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? (Slovenia)
P.body: This question will resolve immediately as **Yes** for countries that participate in a Semi-final and are then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other countries, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
The Eurovision Song Contest 2024 is set to take place in Malmö, Sweden, following the country's victory at the 2023 contest. The contest will be held at the Malmö Arena, and will consist of two semi-finals on 7 and 9 May, and a final on 11 May 2024.

Of the 37 participating countries, 6 are guaranteed to participate in the final: The hosting country (Sweden) and the "Big Five" countries (United Kingdom, France, Germany, Italy and Spain). The remaining 31 countries will have to compete in the Semi-finals. In each Semi-final, 10 countries will qualify for the final, and the rest will not.

More information can be found on [Wikipedia](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/21827/countries-in-eurovision-2024-final/)

See also: [How the Eurovision Song Contest works](https://eurovision.tv/about/how-it-works)

P.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

Q_given_P.title: Given the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, will "deepfake" be said in the CNN debate on June 27, 2024?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. Then, during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, will Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utter the word "deepfake"?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves as YES if the ICC issues an arrest warrant for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024. Resolves as NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as YES if during the CNN debate on June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators says "deepfake." Resolves as NO otherwise. The determination will be made by Metaculus's Admins, who may consult CNN's official transcript.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The ICC issues arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, and (b) "Deepfake" is said by Trump, Biden, or a moderator in the CNN debate on June 27, 2024?
P_and_Q.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members:
- Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
- Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
- Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

(b) During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." The determination of whether "deepfake" has been uttered will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins, who may consult CNN's official transcript. If both conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

P.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

metadata.background_info:
In April 29, 2024, Axios [reported](https://www.axios.com/2024/04/29/netanyahu-biden-icc-arrest-warrants-war-crimes) that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu asked US President Joe Biden to help prevent the International Criminal Court (ICC) in The Hague from issuing arrest warrants for Israeli cabinet officials stemming from possible allegations of war crimes in Gaza. NBC [reported](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/israel-fears-icc-issue-arrest-warrants-netanyahu-gaza-war-hamas-rcna149739) that these arrest warrants could come as early as this week, and Israel is working through back channels to try to prevent them from being issued. The US and other G7 countries are [reportedly](https://www.timesofisrael.com/report-several-nations-urging-icc-not-to-issue-arrest-warrants-for-israelis/) campaigning to dissuade the ICC from issuing the warrants so as to avoid jeopardizing a peace deal between Israel and Hamas.

As the ICC [explains](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) on its official website, an arrest warrant is requested by the Prosecutor as part of the investigative stage before trial, especially in cases in which suspects do not appear voluntarily.

The ICC [was founded](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Criminal_Court) in 2002 following the wars in Rwanda and the former Yugoslavia, and it is [intended](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2024/04/29/icc-israel-warrants-gaza/) as a permanent court to investigate war crimes, genocide and crimes against humanity done by individuals. It issued its first arrest warrants in 2005, and according to the AP [has issued](https://apnews.com/article/israel-hamas-gaza-international-criminal-court-hague-palestinians-1f683a6e2e150d91c415eb1d0a19a44d) a total of 42 arrest warrants. Last year the ICC issued arrest warrants for [Vladimir Putin](https://www.icc-cpi.int/news/situation-ukraine-icc-judges-issue-arrest-warrants-against-vladimir-vladimirovich-putin-and) and one of his government officials stemming from the ICC's investigation into the deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia.

See Also

Base rate information at Wikipedia: [International Criminal Court investigations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Criminal_Court_investigations)

Q.title: Will Trump, Biden or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
Q.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

Determination of whether one of the candidates or moderators has uttered "deepfake" will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins. They will be the sole deciders of whether this has happened or not, and their decision will be final. In cases of ambiguity they may consult CNN's official transcript, typically posted at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It's important to note, however, that in the absence of a clear utterance of the word, especially if it does not appear in the transcript, this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
Related Metaculus question: [Will a politician claim they lost a major election due to a "deepfake" image, video, or audio recording in a G20 country before 2025?](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/17180/deepfake-costs-election-before-2025/)

Both candidates have recently had exposure to the subject:

- In his interview with Youtube podcaster Logan Paul on June 13, 2024, Donald Trump [discussed](https://youtu.be/xrFdHO7FH8w?si=f-f0AMwAt_S0F5pB&t=2741) deepfakes, describing them as "disconcerting" and "alarming," although avoiding specific usage of the word. 

- Joe Biden's press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre on June 10, 2024, [described](https://wcyb.com/news/nation-world/white-house-claims-recent-viral-videos-of-biden-are-actually-deepfakes-president-joe-biden-karine-jean-pierre-normandy-france-apulia-italy-g7-summit-2024-election-politics) viral videos of Joe Biden appearing confused as "deepfakes." 

CNN's current plans are for the debate to be [moderated by](https://www.cnn.com/2024/06/15/politics/trump-biden-cnn-debate-rules/index.html) Jake Tapper and Dana Bash. It will be 90 minutes, with two commercial breaks.

See also: 

Washington Post [AI deepfakes threaten to upend global elections. No one can stop them.](https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2024/04/23/ai-deepfake-election-2024-us-india/)

[Purdue profs show how deepfakes could impact 2024 presidential election](https://www.wishtv.com/news/i-team-8/purdue-profs-show-how-deepfakes-could-impact-2024-presidential-election/)

reasons: The political climate surrounding the International Criminal Court (ICC) and its actions may influence the tone and content of political debates, including references to terms like 'deepfake' which are relevant to discussions about misinformation and media integrity.

If there is a significant event related to the ICC, it could become a topic of discussion during the debate, prompting candidates to mention terms like 'deepfake' in relation to the credibility of media coverage.
Both questions pertain to significant political events happening around the same time, so there may be a public interest in how they intersect.
relevance.conclusion: While the two questions are unrelated on the surface, there are potential political and media dynamics that could connect them in a discussion context.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on OpenAI publishing a report with external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024, will JD Vance say "Couch" before August?
Q_given_P.body:

Resolution criteria for the condition: OpenAI must publish a public report with external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if J.D. Vance mentions the word "Couch" (including pluralization/possessive forms) during the specified time frame through verbal usage or written usage on his official communication channels. Resolves NO if he does not.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) OpenAI publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024 (b) JD Vance says "Couch" before August 2024?

(a) This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) This question resolves to "Yes" if J.D. Vance publicly mentions the word "Couch" between July 25, 5:30 PM ET and July 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market. A 'mention' includes:

P.body: For each AI lab, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

metadata.background_info:
On July 21, 2023, the White House announced ([fact sheet](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2023/07/21/fact-sheet-biden-harris-administration-secures-voluntary-commitments-from-leading-artificial-intelligence-companies-to-manage-the-risks-posed-by-ai/), [full report](https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Ensuring-Safe-Secure-and-Trustworthy-AI.pdf)) that Amazon, Anthropic, Google, Inflection, Meta, Microsoft, and OpenAI have voluntarily committed to manage AI risks.

The voluntary commitments are in three categories (a) "Ensuring Products are Safe Before Introducing Them to the Public", (b) "Building Systems that Put Security First", and (c) "Earning the Public’s Trust", and are "designed to advance a generative AI legal and policy regime".

From [Microsoft](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/openai/concepts/red-teaming), "historically described systematic adversarial attacks for testing security vulnerabilities. With the rise of LLMs, the term has extended beyond traditional cybersecurity and evolved in common usage to describe many kinds of probing, testing, and attacking of AI systems." Note that this question only asks about _safety_, not _security_. [Google](https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/6625378258649088/google-and-alphabet-vulnerability-reward-program-vrp-rules) and [OpenAI](https://bugcrowd.com/openai) already have bug bounties for security.

Of the 37 participating countries, 6 are guaranteed to participate in the final: The hosting country (Sweden) and the "Big Five" countries (United Kingdom, France, Germany, Italy and Spain). P.body: This question will resolve Yes if Poland is the winner of the WTC 2024 as announced on the official site or the official social media of the organisation.

metadata.background_info:
Warhammer 40,000 is a miniature wargame produced by Games Workshop. Set in the far future, players collect, assemble, and paint miniature figures representing warriors, creatures, and vehicles from various factions. Players then pit their armies against each other on a tabletop battlefield. Warhammer 40,000 is currently the [most popular](https://icv2.com/print/article/56556) miniature wargame in the world.

Each year, the World Team Championship (WTC) is organized, where 8-player teams from around the world compete against each other. The teams are separated into 4 seeding groups based on past performance. In the group stage of the tournament, 10 groups are formed with 4 teams each (one from each seeding group). Group stage performance determines the overall ranking among teams, which then compete in a further 4 games following a [Swiss format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swiss-system_tournament). The team with the most total points from the group and Swiss stages is crowned the winner.

This year, the WTC takes place in Mechelen, Belgium from August 8th to 11th. 40 national teams are competing, including 5 first-time competitors: Andorra, China, Mexico, Singapore/Thailand, and South Korea. The full list of teams and seeding groups can be found [here](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=847246644093139). Past performance can be found [here](https://worldteamchampionship.com/about/history/).

Q.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
Q.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
According to the [New York Times](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/11/world/europe/france-conservatives-far-right-alliance.html):

>The head of France’s conservative party on Tuesday *(June 12, 2024)* called for an alliance with the far right in upcoming snap elections, breaking a longstanding taboo and throwing his party into deep turmoil as the shock waves from President Emmanuel Macron’s decision to dissolve the lower house of Parliament coursed through the country.

In France, due to the incentives of the country's electoral system, coalitions are [generally necessary](https://shs.hal.science/halshs-03359160) prior to the election rather than afterwards as is the case in most parliamentary democracies. National Rally is #1 in the [polling averages](https://www.politico.eu/europe-poll-of-polls/france/), which is creating unprecedented incentives for mainstream French conservatives, who may be faced with the choice of either allying with National Rally if they want to regain power or else in practical terms facing a higher probability of losing the election.

reasons: Both events involve teams and organizations that have a competitive element, which might draw interest from the same audience.
The outcome of the Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship could influence the popularity or visibility of the participating countries, potentially affecting political sentiments or cultural pride.
Both events occur in 2024, making them contemporaneously relevant, which could lead to speculation about how success in one area might affect perceptions or strategies in another.
relevance.conclusion: The logical combination is somewhat relevant, as both questions pertain to events happening in 2024 and could attract similar audiences, but the direct connection is weak.

metadata.background_info:
The [Bombay Stock Exchange Sensitive Index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BSE_SENSEX), also known as the S&P BSE SENSEX or simply the SENSEX, is a stock market index consisting of 30 of the largest companies listed on the Bombay Stock Exchange. It is one of the oldest and most widely followed equity indices in India. The SENSEX is intended to reflect the overall performance of the Indian stock market.

India's recent general elections saw incumbent Prime Minister Narendra Modi's party, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), win a [narrower victory](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/india-election-modi-bjp-lost-majority-election-surprise-rcna155557) than expected, raising concerns about potential policy paralysis and the ability of the government to implement key economic reforms. As a result, in the immediate aftermath of the elections, the SENSEX has experienced significant volatility, beginning with a [drop of almost 6%](https://www.aljazeera.com/economy/2024/6/5/india-election-why-modis-narrow-win-has-the-stock-market-in-a-spin) on June 4th, followed by a significant bounce on June 5th.

P.title: Will these AI labs launch a mechanism to enable users to understand if content is generated by their AIs before July 1, 2024? (Google Deep Mind)
P.body: For each AI lab, this question resolves as **YES** if the lab publicly releases a tool to check if some text, audio, or visual content is generated by their AI models before July 1, 2024.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on Google Deep Mind launching a mechanism to identify AI-generated content before July 1, 2024, will Yuki Tsunoda outscore Daniel Ricciardo at the 2024 Formula 1 Belgian Grand Prix?
Q_given_P.body:
For Google Deep Mind, the condition resolves as **YES** if they publicly release a tool to check if some text, audio, or visual content is generated by their AI models before July 1, 2024.

Regarding the outcome, it resolves YES if Yuki Tsunoda outscores Daniel Ricciardo over the whole weekend of the 2024 Formula 1 Belgian Grand Prix, including sprint races. It resolves NO if they score the same non-zero number of points. If neither driver scores, it resolves based on classification order in the main race.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Google Deep Mind launches a mechanism to enable users to understand if content is generated by their AIs before July 1, 2024, and (b) Yuki Tsunoda outscores Daniel Ricciardo at the 2024 Formula 1 Belgian Grand Prix?
P_and_Q.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Google Deep Mind publicly releases a tool to check if some text, audio, or visual content is generated by their AI models before July 1, 2024.

2. Yuki Tsunoda outscores Daniel Ricciardo over the whole weekend at the 2024 Formula 1 Belgian Grand Prix, including sprint races. If they score the same non-zero number of points, it resolves as NO. If neither driver scores, it resolves based on classification order in the main race.

Markets are resolved according to these rules, which are subject to change.

P.title: Will these AI labs launch a mechanism to enable users to understand if content is generated by their AIs before July 1, 2024? (Google Deep Mind)
P.body: For each AI lab, this question resolves as **YES** if the lab publicly releases a tool to check if some text, audio, or visual content is generated by their AI models before July 1, 2024.

metadata.background_info:
On July 21, 2023, the White House announced ([fact sheet](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2023/07/21/fact-sheet-biden-harris-administration-secures-voluntary-commitments-from-leading-artificial-intelligence-companies-to-manage-the-risks-posed-by-ai/), [full report](https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Ensuring-Safe-Secure-and-Trustworthy-AI.pdf)) that Amazon, Anthropic, Google, Inflection, Meta, Microsoft, and OpenAI have voluntarily committed to manage AI risks.

The voluntary commitments are in three categories (a) "Ensuring Products are Safe Before Introducing Them to the Public", (b) "Building Systems that Put Security First", and (c) "Earning the Public’s Trust", and are "designed to advance a generative AI legal and policy regime".

In this last category, one commitment is to "Develop and deploy mechanisms that enable users to understand if audio or visual content is AI-generated, including robust provenance, watermarking, or both, for AI-generated audio or visual content." This question asks whether this commitment is met in the specified time frame.

OpenAI has [worked on such a watermarking tool](https://techcrunch.com/2022/12/10/openais-attempts-to-watermark-ai-text-hit-limits/), in part devised by computing researcher Scott Aaronson, but has not released such a tool publicly as required for this question.

 Markets are resolved according to these rules, which are subject to change.

P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
P.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

Q_given_P.title: If 538 Projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, will either Drake or Kendrick Lamar release a diss track in May?
Q_given_P.body:
This question combines the political forecast with a music industry event. 

Condition: Joe Biden must have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this condition resolves 50-50. 

Outcome: Resolves **Yes** if either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases another diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024. 

If the condition is not met, the question resolves N/A.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday, July 19, 2024? (2) Will either Drake or Kendrick Lamar release another diss track intended for the other in May 2024?
P_and_Q.body:
(1) This question resolves to **Yes** if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this question will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

(2) This question resolves to **Yes** if either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases another diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024.

The combined question resolves to **Yes** only if both conditions (1) and (2) are met.

P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
P.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

content.text: This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.
The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast,
https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/

Q.title: Drake vs Kendrick Lamar: will either artist release another diss track in May?
Q.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases another diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024.

metadata.background_info:
Popular rappers Drake and Kendrick Lamar have been publicly feuding after a years-long contempt has bubbled into an all-out war, with each artist leveling enormous unsubstantiated accusations at the other. After the most recent round of the beef, with the release of Kendrick's "Not Like Us" and Drake's "The Heart Part 6", many have speculated that the feud has reached a tipping point and neither artist will release any further music. Do you think it's been played out, or there's more yet?

Further Background: [Wikipedia Drake–Kendrick Lamar feud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drake%E2%80%93Kendrick_Lamar_feud)

reasons: Both questions involve high-profile public figures (Biden, Drake, Kendrick Lamar) and their actions could influence public perception and discourse, making them relevant in cultural and political contexts.
The outcome of Biden's forecast could impact the music industry indirectly, as political climates can influence cultural production and artist behavior.
The combination could be of interest to those analyzing trends in celebrity behavior in relation to political events.
relevance.conclusion: While the two questions are not directly related, they both pertain to prominent figures in American culture and politics, which may lead to some interesting analyses on their interplay.

P.title: Will Poland win the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship?
P.body: This question will resolve Yes if Poland is the winner of the WTC 2024 as announced on the official site or the official social media of the organisation.

Q_given_P.title: If Poland wins the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship, will the Prime Minister of France belong to the New Popular Front coalition on July 30, 2024?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Poland wins the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship. This will resolve Yes if Poland is the winner of the WTC 2024 as announced on the official site or the official social media of the organisation.

Then, is it true that the Prime Minister of France will belong to the New Popular Front coalition on July 30, 2024? This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is New Popular Front on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

P_and_Q.title: Will Poland win the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship and will the Prime Minister of France belong to the New Popular Front coalition on July 30, 2024?
P_and_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Poland is the winner of the WTC 2024 as announced on the official site or the official social media of the organisation. (2) The party of the Prime Minister of France is New Popular Front on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

P.title: Will Poland win the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship?
P.body: This question will resolve Yes if Poland is the winner of the WTC 2024 as announced on the official site or the official social media of the organisation.

metadata.background_info:
Warhammer 40,000 is a miniature wargame produced by Games Workshop. Set in the far future, players collect, assemble, and paint miniature figures representing warriors, creatures, and vehicles from various factions. Players then pit their armies against each other on a tabletop battlefield. Warhammer 40,000 is currently the [most popular](https://icv2.com/print/article/56556) miniature wargame in the world.

Each year, the World Team Championship (WTC) is organized, where 8-player teams from around the world compete against each other. The teams are separated into 4 seeding groups based on past performance. In the group stage of the tournament, 10 groups are formed with 4 teams each (one from each seeding group). Group stage performance determines the overall ranking among teams, which then compete in a further 4 games following a [Swiss format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swiss-system_tournament). The team with the most total points from the group and Swiss stages is crowned the winner.

This year, the WTC takes place in Mechelen, Belgium from August 8th to 11th. 40 national teams are competing, including 5 first-time competitors: Andorra, China, Mexico, Singapore/Thailand, and South Korea. The full list of teams and seeding groups can be found [here](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=847246644093139). Past performance can be found [here](https://worldteamchampionship.com/about/history/).

Q.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to the New Popular Front coalition on July 30, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is New Popular Front on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

metadata.background_info:
After a far-right victory in the European elections, French President Emmanuel Macron dissolved the National Assembly, calling snap elections for June 30th and July 7th.

The majority of the 577 districts will [see a runoff](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/french-election-run-off-how-does-it-work-what-look-out-2024-07-05/) on Sunday, July 7, with the most common set of qualified parties being the National Rally-led Union of the Far-Right, centrist Together, and left and center-left New Popular Front. The unprecedented number of three-way runoffs (including *four*-ways in five districts) was boosted by strong turnout, [nearly 20 percentage points more than in 2022](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/strong-turnout-france-high-stakes-elections-support-far-right-grows/); but Together and the NPF guided their third-placed candidates to withdraw to improve the other's chances to beat the far-right, mostly represented by Marine Le Pen's National Rally.

Once the runoff numbers are known for the 17th National Assembly, the question becomes: who will be Prime Minister? The French semi-presidential system gives President Macron political responsibilities, in particular in foreign policy, regardless of the makeup of Parliament; but he must also nominate a Prime Minister, who conducts domestic policy. The government does not need a positive confidence vote from legislators, but it could be subject to a vote of no confidence; current Prime Minister Gabriel Attal's minority government has been relying on case-by-case deals to get legislation approved.

While the far-right has already elected 38 Deputies and made it to the runoff almost everywhere, its surge might still be forestalled by the strategic pact between the center and the left.

reasons: Both questions pertain to events occurring in 2024, making them contemporaneously relevant.

There may be overlapping interests among communities that follow these events, such as gaming enthusiasts and political analysts who might be curious about how cultural events influence political landscapes or vice versa.
relevance.conclusion: While the events are distinct, the combination could be of interest to niche groups that track both competitive gaming and political shifts in Europe.

P.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

Q_given_P.title: Given Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Between the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. 

Then, will Elon Musk become a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024? This market will resolve YES if he does appear as a guest on the official stage during the event.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Israel will carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and (b) Elon Musk will show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
P_and_Q.body:
(a) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) This market will resolve YES, if Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

P.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

metadata.background_info: In a significant escalation of regional tensions, [Iran launched a coordinated aerial attack targeting Israeli territory on April 13, 2024](https://www.wsj.com/world/middle-east/iran-tries-to-calibrate-response-against-israel-after-deadly-bombing-abb38b57). This action by Iran came as a direct retaliation for an [Israeli airstrike earlier in the month](https://apnews.com/article/israel-syria-airstrike-iranian-embassy-edca34c52d38c8bc57281e4ebf33b240#:~:text=An%20Israeli%20airstrike%20in%20a,at%20least%20five%20Iranian%20advisers.), which struck the Iranian Embassy complex in Damascus, Syria, which resulted in the deaths of seven Iranian officers, including three high-ranking commanders, intensifying Iran's resolve to respond.

P.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on Democrats having a brokered convention in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, resulting in a brokered convention. Then, will the winning time of the men's 100m race at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 be less than 9.63 seconds, thereby breaking the Olympic record? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves as Yes if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting to nominate its candidate. Resolves as No if only one ballot is required.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as Yes if the winning time of the men's 100m race is less than 9.63 seconds. Resolves as No otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) The men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s?
P_and_Q.body: This question resolves as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. (2) The winning time of the men's 100m race at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 is less than 9.63 seconds.

P.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
In US politics a brokered convention is [defined as](https://www.brookings.edu/articles/what-is-a-brokered-convention-what-is-a-contested-convention/) a nominating convention in which no candidate has won a majority of the votes in the first round of voting by the delegates. In the 19th Century, brokered conventions were quite common. However, in the 31 presidential elections since the turn of the 20th Century, the Democratic Party has had 5 brokered conventions: | Year | Number of ballots | Nominee | |------|-------------------|--------------------------------| | 1952 | 3 | Adlai Stevenson | | 1932 | 4 | Franklin D. Roosevelt | | 1924 | 103 | John Davis | | 1920 | 44 | James Cox | | 1912 | 46 | Woodrow Wilson | On paper, one might argue that President Joe Biden should be able to fairly easily avoid a brokered convention due to winning 99% of [pledged delegates](https://www.usatoday.com/elections/results/2024/presidential-delegates). Additionally, the Democratic Party's [current plan](https://sourcenm.com/2024/06/24/dnc-moves-ahead-on-all-virtual-roll-call-for-biden-presidential-nomination/) is to hold its roll call virtually, before the in-person Convention and before Ohio's August 7th ballot deadline. However, following Biden's debate with Donald Trump on June 28, 2024, which the New York Times described as "[disastrous](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/30/us/politics/biden-debate-anxious-democrats.html)," there was a widespread "freak out" among Democrats [according to Politico](https://archive.ph/mhK7S), which reported that "One prominent operative texted, 'Time for an open convention.'" There were calls for Biden to bow out of the race, for example the NY Times [Editorial Board](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/28/opinion/biden-election-debate-trump.html) and influential columnist [Thomas Friedman](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/28/opinion/joe-biden-tom-friedman.html). However, as of June 30, 2024, prominent Democrats continued to publicly stand behind Biden, such as former President [Barack Obama](https://www.axios.com/2024/06/28/obama-rescue-biden-calm-nervous-democrats-2024-election) and Congressman [James E. Clyburn](https://thehill.com/homenews/house/4746240-clyburn-biden-debate/). Initial polling after the debate [found](https://www.forbes.com/sites/brianbushard/2024/06/29/warning-signs-for-biden-post-debate-polls-show-more-voters-worried-about-bidens-fitness-but-race-still-virtually-tied/) that increasing numbers of voters believe Biden should drop out. On June 26, 2024 , the day before the debate, Biden was behind Trump by 0.1 in the [538 polling averages](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/). On June 30th, following several post-debate polls, Biden's deficit swelled to 1.3 points. See Also Pew Research: [Contested presidential conventions, and why parties try to avoid them](https://www.pewresearch.org/short-reads/2016/02/04/contested-presidential-conventions-and-why-parties-try-to-avoid-them/)
US News & World Report: [What Is an Open Convention and Why Do Some Democrats Want One?](https://www.usnews.com/news/national-news/articles/2024-06-28/what-is-an-open-convention-and-why-do-some-democrats-want-one)
Wikipedia: [Brokered convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brokered_convention)
The Atlantic: [The Biden-Replacement Operation](https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2024/06/great-democratic-conundrum-biden/678830/)

Q.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
Q.body: This question resolves as Yes if the winning time of the men's 100m race is less than 9.63s.

metadata.background_info: Usain Bolt's 9.63s Olympic record has stood since the 2012 London Olympics. Will it be broken in Paris 2024?

reasons: The outcome of the Democratic convention could influence public interest and media coverage leading up to the Olympics, potentially affecting athletes' performances due to added pressure or distraction.
Political climate and public sentiment leading up to the convention might indirectly affect funding and sponsorship for Olympic athletes, which could influence their performance.
Both events are significant in 2024 and could be part of broader discussions about American culture and international representation.
relevance.conclusion: While there are some indirect connections between the two events, they are largely independent of each other, making the logical combination less compelling.

Q.title: Which of these countries will qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? (Iceland)
Q.body: This question will resolve immediately as **Yes** for countries that participate in a Semi-final and are then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other countries, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
The Eurovision Song Contest 2024 is set to take place in Malmö, Sweden, following the country's victory at the 2023 contest. The contest will be held at the Malmö Arena, and will consist of two semi-finals on 7 and 9 May, and a final on 11 May 2024.

Of the 37 participating countries, 6 are guaranteed to participate in the final: The hosting country (Sweden) and the "Big Five" countries (United Kingdom, France, Germany, Italy and Spain). The remaining 31 countries will have to compete in the Semi-finals. In each Semi-final, 10 countries will qualify for the final, and the rest will not.

More information can be found on [Wikipedia](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/21827/countries-in-eurovision-2024-final/)

See also: [How the Eurovision Song Contest works](https://eurovision.tv/about/how-it-works)

reasons: The political landscape in the US can influence international events, including cultural phenomena like Eurovision, as public sentiment and political climates can affect national pride and participation in such events.

If Biden drops out, it could lead to a shift in the Democratic party's strategy and priorities, potentially influencing how they engage with international events, including support for cultural events like Eurovision.

There might be a perceived connection between political stability and national representation in international competitions, leading some to consider the implications of political decisions on cultural representation.
relevance.conclusion: While the two questions seem unrelated at first glance, there could be indirect connections through political influence on cultural events, making the logical combination worth considering for some analysts.

P.title: Which of these countries will qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? (Portugal)
P.body: This question will resolve immediately as **Yes** for countries that participate in a Semi-final and are then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other countries, the question will resolve as **No**.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on Portugal qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 2, 2024?
Q_given_P.body:
This question examines the relationship between Portugal's qualification for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and the year-over-year change in the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) on July 2, 2024.

Criterion for condition: Portugal must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be considered higher if the reported number on July 2, 2024, as reported by the St. Louis Fed, is greater than the reported number on July 2, 2023. If Portugal does not qualify, this question resolves as N/A.

P_and_Q.title: Will Portugal qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 2, 2024?
P_and_Q.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 2, 2024, is greater than the number reported on July 2, 2023. If either or both conditions are not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
In May 2024, sunspot region AR3664, now designated as AR3697, returned to face Earth after merging with another active sunspot region, resulting in numerous M- and X-class solar flares that caused intense [geomagnetic storms and auroras](https://earthsky.org/earth/auroras-last-night-extreme-solar-storm-wow-millions-may-10-11-12-2024/) visible at unusually low latitudes. 

As AR3697 [returns to face Earth](https://www.space.com/return-aurora-causing-sunspot-june-solar-storm-prospects) in early June 2024, space weather forecasters anticipate ongoing geomagnetic activity and are closely monitoring the region's continued potential to produce extreme space weather. 

[Sunspots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunspot) are areas of intense magnetic activity that often give rise to solar flares and coronal mass ejections (CMEs), which can disturb Earth's magnetosphere and impact satellite operations, power grids, and navigation systems.

The [K-index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-index), which measures fluctuations in Earth's magnetic field, ranges from from 0 to 9. The NOAA Space Weather Scales uses the Kp values to classify the severity of geomagnetic storms from G1 (minor) to G5 (extreme), equating to Kp values of 5 to 9, respectively.

Q.title: Will Poland win the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship?
Q.body: This question will resolve Yes if Poland is the winner of the WTC 2024 as announced on the official site or the official social media of the organisation.

metadata.background_info:
Warhammer 40,000 is a miniature wargame produced by Games Workshop. Set in the far future, players collect, assemble, and paint miniature figures representing warriors, creatures, and vehicles from various factions. Players then pit their armies against each other on a tabletop battlefield. Warhammer 40,000 is currently the [most popular](https://icv2.com/print/article/56556) miniature wargame in the world.

Each year, the World Team Championship (WTC) is organized, where 8-player teams from around the world compete against each other. The teams are separated into 4 seeding groups based on past performance. In the group stage of the tournament, 10 groups are formed with 4 teams each (one from each seeding group). Group stage performance determines the overall ranking among teams, which then compete in a further 4 games following a [Swiss format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swiss-system_tournament). The team with the most total points from the group and Swiss stages is crowned the winner.

This year, the WTC takes place in Mechelen, Belgium from August 8th to 11th. 40 national teams are competing, including 5 first-time competitors: Andorra, China, Mexico, Singapore/Thailand, and South Korea. The full list of teams and seeding groups can be found [here](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=847246644093139). Past performance can be found [here](https://worldteamchampionship.com/about/history/).

Q.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
Q.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
Elon Musk is the current CEO of Tesla and owns around 13% of the company. During its founding years in 2003 - 2005, Musk invested heavily into the company, eventually becoming chair of the board of directors and one of the largest shareholders; he subsequently became CEO in October 2008. His success at the company has seen Tesla become the 17th largest company in the world by market cap with its share price soaring since its June 2010 IPO.

As a result of his immense success as CEO, a $56 billion pay package to Musk was approved by Tesla's board of the directors in 2018. However, Musk has yet to receive this package, as per the [FT](https://www.ft.com/content/8d823cef-543a-4d33-afa0-c68f081842d1):

>Tesla’s board has been lobbying investors to re-ratify the $56bn award given in 2018, which was struck down by a Delaware judge in January due to concerns over its size and the independence of the board. In response, Musk vowed to leave the state and move Tesla’s incorporation to Texas.

>Tesla chair Robyn Denholm has argued that Musk deserves to be paid so much because the company hit ambitious targets for revenue and its stock price. She brushed off criticism she is too close to the CEO as “crap”.

Aside from the sheer size of the pay package - the largest of its kind - those who oppose it call into question various decisions made by Musk during his tenure as CEO. In particular,  Musk's social media activity has been called into question, and perhaps most notably the:

- Purchase - and subsequent rebrand - of Twitter (now X) for $44 billion which has attracted a lot of negative criticism and has also seen Musk spend a disproportionate amount of time at that company instead of Tesla.

 - Purchase of $1.5 billion of Bitcoin in 2021 and allowing the cryptocurrency to be used by customers for purchasing Tesla automobiles. The company promptly stopped accepting the currency - causing the price to plummet - after which Tesla announced they had sold almost all of their Bitcoin holdings at a loss.

During significant shareholder votes like this one, influential proxy advisory firms often send out advice to shareholders on what to vote and why. According to [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proxy_firm):

>A proxy firm provides services to shareholders (in most cases an institutional investor of some type) to vote their shares at shareholder meetings of, usually, listed companies.

The two largest proxy advisory firms are ISS and Glass Lewis. The latter has [advised](https://www.ft.com/content/8d823cef-543a-4d33-afa0-c68f081842d1) shareholders *not* to vote in favour of Musk's package as well as advising shareholders to vote against the re-election of Kimbal Musk - brother of Elon Musk - from the board of directors. The ISS, however, has yet to issue any advice with respect to the June 13 shareholder meeting.

---------------------

See related question:

[*Will a non-Disney-nominated board member be elected to Disney's board at the April 3, 2024, shareholder meeting?*](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/21972/non-disney-board-member-elected-april-2024/)

If the break in the manga leads to increased discussions or trends that impact public perception of Tesla or its leadership, it could be of interest to analyze the two questions together.
relevance.conclusion: While the two questions seem unrelated at first glance, there are potential cultural and social dynamics that could make their logical combination interesting for certain audiences.

P.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.background_info:
[Gold medal wins at the Summer Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All-time_Olympic_Games_medal_table) are concentrated in a small number of countries; the United States alone has won nearly 20% of every gold medal ever awarded, and a total of eight countries account for the majority of medalists.

Conversely, prior to the opening of the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, there are over 100 National Olympic Committees that have never won a gold medal. In recent Games, the number of countries that won their first gold were:

* London 2012: 3
* Rio de Janeiro 2016: 9
